<script>
//subscribe android app
jQuery(document).ready(function(){
   jQuery('#submit-subscribe-android-app').click(function(){
       var email = jQuery('#email-subscribe-android-app').val();
       if(email){
           jQuery.ajax({
               url: "/subscriptions/early-android-access.php",
               type: "POST",
               data: {
                   "email": email
               },
               success: function(data){
                   if(data.success){
                       jQuery("#bg-sbox ul").hide(1);
                       jQuery("#bg-sbox h5").text('yay!');
                       jQuery("#bg-sbox p.msg1").text('Your email has been added to our beta list');
                       jQuery("#bg-sbox p.msg2").text('You will hear from us soon');
                   } else {
                       jQuery("#bg-sbox h5").text('Something went wrong, try again!');
                       console.log(data.error);
                   }
               },
               error: function(e){
                   console.log(e);
                   jQuery("#bg-sbox h5").text('Something went wrong, try again!');
               }
           })
       }
   });
});
</script>
<script>
jQuery(document).ready(function(){
	jQuery(".filter-button").click(function(){
		var value = jQuery(this).attr('data-filter');
       if(value == "all"){
           $('.filter').show('1000');
       }else{
			jQuery(".filter").not('.'+value).hide('3000');
			jQuery('.filter').filter('.'+value).show('3000');
       }
   });
});
</script>

     jQuery(document).ready(function(){
       jQuery('.footer-links-holder .links-show').click(function () {
       jQuery(this).parent().toggleClass('active');
     });
   });
</script>

<script>
    $(document).ready(function(){
        var cat_id1 = 3761;
        var cat_id2 = 3952;
        var cat_id3 = 4939;

        var cat2 = [5,8];
        var type = $('meta[property="og:title"]').attr("content");
        // alert(type);
        // Popup on Category
        if (jQuery.inArray(cat_id3, cat2) !='-1'){
                 var cat3 = "Download the infographic to crack your data science interview anywhere in the world!";
                 var cat1 = "7 Steps to Ace Data Science Interview";
                 var cat = 4939;
             }
        else if (jQuery.inArray(cat_id1, cat2) !='-1'){
            var cat3 = "Download this resource to build your first computer vision model in just 10 minutes.";
            var cat1 = "Computer Vision Model in 10 minutes";
            var cat = 3761;
        }else if(jQuery.inArray(cat_id2, cat2) !='-1'){
            var cat3 = "Download your text classification project here to build your first NLP model.";
            var cat1 = "Your Text Classification Project";
            var cat = 3952;

<article id="post-293" class="main-content single-post-box">
<header>
<meta itemprop="headline" content="Advanced analytics certifications in India">
<meta itemprop="datecreated" content="2013-07-06T21:13:46+00:00">
<meta itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-07-06T21:13:46+00:00">
<meta itemprop="dateModified" content="2019-01-07T18:01:28+00:00">
<meta itemscope itemprop="mainEntityOfPage" itemType="https://schema.org/WebPage" itemid="https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2013/07/advanced-analytics-certifications/" />
<span class="hidden" itemprop="image" itemscope itemtype="https://schema.org/ImageObject">
<meta itemprop="url" content="https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/01/2.jpg">
<meta itemprop="width" content="550">
<meta itemprop="height" content="550">
</span>
<span class="hidden" itemprop="publisher" itemscope itemtype="https://schema.org/Organization">
<span class="hidden" itemprop="logo" itemscope itemtype="https://schema.org/ImageObject">
<meta itemprop="url" content="https://s3-ap-south-1.amazonaws.com/av-blog-media/wp-content/uploads/2017/03/18122331/av100.png">
</span>
<meta itemprop="name" content="Analytics Vidhya">
</span>
<div class="meta-count">
<span class="i-category"><span class="mh-cat-item"><a class="mh-elcat-5" href="https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/category/business-analytics/" title="Business Analytics" rel="category">Business Analytics</a></span><span class="mh-cat-item"><a class="mh-elcat-8" href="https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/category/business-intelligence/" title="Business Intelligence" rel="category">Business Intelligence</a></span></span>
</div>
<h1 itemprop="name" class="entry-title">Advanced analytics certifications in India</h1>
<div class="meta-info">
<span class="entry-author">
<a href="https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/author/kunalj/"><span>Kunal Jain</span></a>,
</span>
<time class="entry-date" content="2013-07-06" datetime="2013-07-06T21:13:46+00:00">
July 6, 2013 </time>
<div class="count-data right">
</div>
<span class="save-for-later"></span>
</div>
</header>
<div class="text-content">
<div id="ban3_av"></div><p style="text-align: justify;">One question a lot of MIS professionals face day to day is:</p>
<h2 style="text-align: center;"><strong>&#8220;How do I shift my career to work in Advanced Analytics?&#8221;</strong></h2>
<p style="text-align: justify;">A lot of people have asked this question to me. While there was no clear path for this around 3 years back, the scenario has changed today. Currently, professionals in MIS industry can undertake various certifications in advanced analytics to jump start their analytics career. This article summarizes various certifications available to people in India and rank orders them based on their merits.</p>
<h3 style="text-align: justify;">Consideration set</h3>
<p style="text-align: justify;">This analysis is aimed for people with work experience. I plan to write a similar article for freshers some time later. Further, I have only considered courses from educational institutes well known across India. I have excluded certifications from Software companies (as they tend to focus on software training rather than the concepts behind) and other smaller training institutes.</p>
<p style="text-align: justify;">Following table summarizes various certification options available as of today:</p>
<p style="text-align: justify;"><a rel="lightbox" href=https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2013/07/analytics_certificate.jpg><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-623" src="https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2013/07/analytics_certificate.jpg" alt="analytics_certificate" width="501" height="241" srcset="https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/07/analytics_certificate.jpg 501w, https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/07/analytics_certificate-300x144.jpg 300w" sizes="(max-width: 501px) 100vw, 501px" /></a></p>
<p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>Note:</strong> <em>There are courses running currently in </em><strong>IIM Bangalore</strong><em> and </em><strong>IIM Lucknow</strong><em> as well, but I am not sure whether they will continue as there is no information on websites of these institutes</em>.</p>
<p style="text-align: justify;">Following are details for each of the courses with link to their websites:</p>
<p style="text-align: justify;"><strong><span style="color: #000000;">Certificate Programme in Business Analytics (CBA), ISB</span></strong></p>
<p style="text-align: justify;">The program is a combination of classroom and Technology aided learning platform. Participants will typically be on campus for a 5 day schedule of classroom learning every alternate month for a span of 12 months, which would ideally be planned to include a weekend.<br />
In the month of no classroom connect, the classes will be conducted over a technology aided learning platform. The contact hours in this platform would be 24 hours a month and every alternate month. One more highlight of the programme is the Action learning project whose runs for 3- 6 months and asks students to solve a real business problem from an organization. For more information, go to:</p>
<p style="text-align: justify;"><a href="http://www.isb.edu/certificate-programme-in-business-analytics">http://www.isb.edu/certificate-programme-in-business-analytics</a></p>
<p style="text-align: justify;"><strong><strong><strong><span style="color: #000000;"><strong>Advanced Certificate Program in Business Analytics (ACPBA), SJMSOM, IIT Bombay</strong></span></strong></strong></strong></p>
<p style="text-align: justify;">Jointly designed by the Shailesh J Mehta School Of Management at IIT Bombay, and HughesNet Global Education, the program is spread over one year and covers both the theoretical and practical aspects of the discipline. Industry experts also contribute to the course by giving lectures and presenting real-life consultancy projects. Towards the end of the course, there is 3 day on campus interaction between students and experts. For more information, go to:</p>
<p style="text-align: justify;"><a href="http://www.hugheseducation.com/ACPBA">http://www.hugheseducation.com/ACPBA</a></p>
<p style="text-align: justify;"><strong><strong><strong><span style="color: #000000;"><strong>Executive Program in Business Analytics, IIM Calcutta</strong></span></strong></strong></strong></p>
<p style="text-align: justify;">Again designed with HughesNet Global education, this executive long distance program is designed to expose participants to state of the art tools and techniques of analytics. The program coverage would include discussion on topics such as Data Mining, Design of Experiments, Survey Sampling, Statistical Inference, Investment Management, Financial Modeling, Advanced marketing Research etc.</p>
<p style="text-align: justify;">There are 2 sessions of 3 hour interaction every week (Thursday and Saturday). For more information, go to:</p>
<p style="text-align: justify;"><a href="http://www.hugheseducation.com/EPBA">http://www.hugheseducation.com/EPBA</a></p>
<p style="text-align: justify;"><strong><strong><strong><span style="color: #000000;"><strong>Advanced Business Analytics &amp; Optimization Program (Two Certifications), CEP, IIT Delhi</strong></span></strong></strong></strong></p>
<p style="text-align: justify;">This program is designed by Ivory education along with DMS, IIT Delhi. It is designed to build Advanced Skills in Business Analytics and Optimization and is divided in two parts. It follows a step-by-step approach where theoretical concepts will be followed by case studies and practical implementations.</p>
<p style="text-align: justify;"><a href="http://www.ivoryeducation.com/dms-iit-delhi-advanced-business-analytics-business-optimization-program/">http://www.ivoryeducation.com/dms-iit-delhi-advanced-business-analytics-business-optimization-program/</a></p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p><strong><strong><strong><span style="color: #000000;"><strong>Verdict</strong></span></strong></strong></strong></p>
<p><strong><strong><strong> </strong></strong></strong>So what would I do if I was a MIS professional?</p>
<p>If I had 4 &#8211; 5 years of experience and the resources, I would go for the course offered by ISB. There are some clear benefits of this course:</p>
<ul style="text-align: justify;">
<li><span style="line-height: 12px;">You get ISB brand on your CV</span></li>
<li>Method of teaching is mostly classroom, there by giving a lot better learning experience</li>
<li>They require higher work experience than most other courses, so you can expect to learn lot more</li>
</ul>
<p style="text-align: justify;">If I had lesser work experience (resources could still be figured through education loans), I would go for the course run by IIM Calcutta because of more time spent to cover similar course material. Hopefully, this would mean that you have more time for interaction and hands on experience.</p>
<p style="text-align: justify;">So, following is the summary of my recommendations for advanced analytics certification:</p>
<p style="text-align: justify;"><a rel="lightbox" href=https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2013/07/analytics_certificate21.jpg><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-627" src="https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2013/07/analytics_certificate21.jpg" alt="analytics_certificate2" width="501" height="321" srcset="https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/07/analytics_certificate21.jpg 501w, https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/07/analytics_certificate21-300x192.jpg 300w" sizes="(max-width: 501px) 100vw, 501px" /></a></p>
<p style="text-align: justify;">Which one would you join if you were a MIS professional? Also, If you are aware of any certification programmes, which could be helpful, please feel free to mention in comments or to write to me.</p>
<p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>P.S.</strong> All views mentioned here are my own and are in no way biased or influenced by any of the institutes above.</p>
<h2 style="text-align: justify;"><strong>If you like what you just read &amp; want to continue your analytics learning, you can <a href="http://feedburner.google.com/fb/a/mailverify?uri=analyticsvidhya" target="_blank" rel="noopener">subscribe to our emails</a> or like our <a href="http://facebook.com/analyticsvidhya" target="_blank" rel="noopener">facebook page</a></strong></h2>

<h3 class="author-name">
<a itemprop="name" content="Kunal Jain" href="https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/author/kunalj/">Kunal Jain</a>
</h3>
<div class="author-desc">
<span class="fn">Kunal is a post graduate from IIT Bombay in Aerospace Engineering. He has spent more than 10 years in field of Data Science. His work experience ranges from mature markets like UK to a developing market like India. During this period he has lead teams of various sizes and has worked on various tools like SAS, SPSS, Qlikview, R, Python and Matlab.</span>

<p>Hi Kunal,</p>
<p>IIM Ranchi has also launched Executive Programme in Business Analytics &amp; Business Intelligence, its a full day class room training spread over few weekends and 5 days training in IIM Ranchi. The course fee is only Rs. 1,50,000. </p>
<p>The link is : &#8211; <a href="http://www.iimranchi.ac.in/" rel="nofollow">http://www.iimranchi.ac.in/</a></p>
<p>Regards,<br />
Deepak Rai</p>

April 27, 2014 at 12:47 pm</a> </div>
<p>HI,</p>
<p>NIIT has started post graduate diploma in business analytics.</p>
<p>Duration- 6 months</p>
<p>timings- weekend saturday 6 hours + sunday 6 hours </p>
<p>2nd option timings &#8211; daily 7.30 to 9.30 pm monday to saturday</p>
<p>fee- 1,15,000- rs.</p>
<p>placement assistance provided.</p>
<p>iim, iit, industry practicing faculty </p>
<p>medium &#8211; through audio video conference ( two way communication)</p>
<p>Best advantage.. you can learn the course through video conferencing from 10-12 cities in india</p>

<li class="comment odd alt depth-5" id="comment-107102">
<div id="div-comment-107102" class="comment-body">
<div class="comment-author vcard">
<img alt='' src='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/5dd257deedaa5c1181365fa3b585e96b?s=100&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g' srcset='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/5dd257deedaa5c1181365fa3b585e96b?s=200&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g 2x' class='avatar avatar-100 photo' height='100' width='100' /> <cite class="fn">Ramesh</cite> <span class="says">says:</span> </div>
<div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2013/07/advanced-analytics-certifications/#comment-107102">
March 11, 2016 at 5:34 pm</a> </div>
<p>NiIT busi ess analytics course is fully bull **** I agree completely to what venu and vaidyanathan says&#8230;<br />
The drawbacks are ..these are my opinions in learning the course for 11 months ..and still finding it useless irrelevant&#8230;</p>
<p>1. NIIT just collects money from u and provide audio video conference and venue..NIIT staff dont know any **** abt the course..NIIT then outsources the course to Insanalytics..a third party vendor to run the course&#8230;so NIIT does not own the course..</p>
<p>2. INS ANALYTICS gets paid by NIIT and they have their own courses separately ..they r not worried abt students and reputation at NIIT &#8230;they just arrange professors and run away ..no direct contact with students..insanalytics Just deals with NIiT and professors..</p>
<p>3. The professors are paid by Insanalytics ..they take class infront of a camera ..they cant answer all the doubts asked by all 300 students from all over india ..they have option to deactivate ur questions and finish the session quuckly..they need to cover 3 batches in one day ..so they are also not worried abt u&#8230;</p>
<p>4. In real you pay 1.2 lakh and submit yourself to miltiple vendors where no one is interested in teaching u any new concept..</p>
<p>5. Job support is zero..my batchmate was working for just rs.17 k inr salary per month ..they didnt even bother to get him a job for rs.25 k inr per month salary.forget salary ..no assistance to get u into any job in analytics industry..</p>
<p>6. Better install free mobile application and learn using youtube videos &#8230;you will actually learn more and can crack an interview&#8230;.</p>
<p>7. In my opinion..all above points r opinions only ..may be legally technically the set up is different ..but this is what i felt in the course&#8230;</p>
<p>Regards,</p>
<p>RAMESH<br />
Statistical Customer survey SME<br />
IT major in chennai</p>

<p>Hi Kunal,</p>
<p>Thank you for your excellent comparison. I have applied for ISB and been shortlisted for interview.<br />
Could you please help me to connect to Swathi? Just want to understand interview process.</p>
<p>Many thanks in advance</p>
<p>Srinivas</p>

<p>Vishwash,</p>
<p>This is a relatively new course. </p>
<p>I would suggest you talk to the Organizer about placement / live project. It&#8217;s best answered by the Organiers. My personal view is that a fresher might not learn a lot from 3 month executive education programme. I wouldn&#8217;t rely too much on the course to help in the placement.</p>
<p>Thanks,<br />
Kunal</p>

<div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2013/07/advanced-analytics-certifications/#comment-324">
September 19, 2013 at 10:36 pm</a> </div>
<p>Hello sir,<br />
I just want to discuss here the conversation between me and IIM ranchi program director of EPBABI.</p>
<p>I have talked to program director Mr. praveen kumar bala, he confirmed me that they will not provide any placements.<br />
But they will forward CV to the companies&#8230;</p>
<p>Also he told me there is loads of demand in the market for BA.</p>
<p>There is one week learning in IIM ranchi.<br />
In IIM Ranchi they will teach IBM cgnos 8 BI tools, SPSS,SAS and R.<br />
Also at last they are providing Hands-on-experience.</p>

<p>Vishwash,</p>
<p>Try and spend time improving structured thinking and writing (you can read Pyramid Principle). Also, it would be great to pre-read basic terms related to Business Analytics, so that while you are at the course, you can focus on learning the concepts and networking with the group.</p>
<p>Thanks,<br />
Kunal</p>

<li class="comment odd alt depth-2 parent" id="comment-300">
<div id="div-comment-300" class="comment-body">
<div class="comment-author vcard">
<img alt='' src='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/8107384750eee00b678ec4975d46ea1a?s=100&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g' srcset='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/8107384750eee00b678ec4975d46ea1a?s=200&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g 2x' class='avatar avatar-100 photo' height='100' width='100' /> <cite class="fn">Deepu Kumar Gouli</cite> <span class="says">says:</span> </div>
<div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2013/07/advanced-analytics-certifications/#comment-300">
September 14, 2013 at 1:23 pm</a> </div>
<p>Hi Vishwas, </p>
<p>Hope you are doing good. </p>
<p>Can you please let me know how to apply for this course (EPBABI), I&#8217;m interested in learning business analytic. Please give me details for the same, I&#8217;m looking out in bangalore.</p>
<p>Hi Kunal, </p>
<p>I have over 6 years of experience in software testing in eCommerce/Retail IT industry. I&#8217;m more interested in getting to business analyst/business analytic roles. Please suggest me, Is this course help me getting into the desired role?</p>
<p>Thank you,<br />
Deepu</p>

<div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2013/07/advanced-analytics-certifications/#comment-286">
September 11, 2013 at 7:58 am</a> </div>
<p>Shammi,</p>
<p>The course by IIM Ranchi is relatively new and they do not provide any placement support. Since its an executive education programme, as of now it will have limited impact on the CV. </p>
<p>Past work experience of your wife would play a far more significant role in short term career opportunities. Additionally, I would urge you to check with the Organizers and Professors at the institute, if they have any tie-ups / live project opportunity.</p>
<p>Thanks,<br />
Kunal</p>
<div class="reply"><a rel='nofollow' class='comment-reply-link' href='#comment-286' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "div-comment-286", "286", "respond", "293" )' aria-label='Reply to Kunal Jain'>Reply</a></div>

<div class="reply"><a rel='nofollow' class='comment-reply-link' href='#comment-307' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "div-comment-307", "307", "respond", "293" )' aria-label='Reply to indranil dasgupta'>Reply</a></div>

<li class="comment byuser comment-author-kunalj bypostauthor odd alt depth-2" id="comment-309">
<div id="div-comment-309" class="comment-body">
<div class="comment-author vcard">
<img alt='' src='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=100&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g' srcset='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=200&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g 2x' class='avatar avatar-100 photo' height='100' width='100' /> <cite class="fn"><a href='http://analyticsvidhya.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Kunal Jain</a></cite> <span class="says">says:</span> </div>
<div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2013/07/advanced-analytics-certifications/#comment-309">
September 16, 2013 at 6:37 am</a> </div>
<p>Indranil,</p>
<p>Most of these courses mentioned in the article are meant for people with little experience, who would work hands on with data themselves. Given your past experience, I am assuming you would have a IT Lead and Analytics Lead in your team. If that is the case, I would suggest that you do courses from outside India which deal with Management part of Analytics. One of the good courses open for registrations currently is <a href="http://www.exed.hbs.edu/programs/data/Pages/default.aspx" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">here</a>. There are various other courses, for which you can find details on KDNuggets.com</p>
<p>On the other hand, if you want to be the hands on data person yourself, I would suggest the course from ISB (but I think they have closed their registrations for this year).</p>
<p>Hope this helps.</p>
<p>Thanks,<br />
Kunal</p>
<div class="reply"><a rel='nofollow' class='comment-reply-link' href='#comment-309' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "div-comment-309", "309", "respond", "293" )' aria-label='Reply to Kunal Jain'>Reply</a></div>
</div>
</li>
</ul>

<li class="comment odd alt thread-even depth-1 parent" id="comment-376">
<div id="div-comment-376" class="comment-body">
<div class="comment-author vcard">
<img alt='' src='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/508f69e9ed19d7c0d5f204a7421f11e0?s=100&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g' srcset='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/508f69e9ed19d7c0d5f204a7421f11e0?s=200&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g 2x' class='avatar avatar-100 photo' height='100' width='100' /> <cite class="fn">Nishant Jain</cite> <span class="says">says:</span> </div>
<div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2013/07/advanced-analytics-certifications/#comment-376">
September 26, 2013 at 7:36 am</a> </div>
<p>Praxis Business School Kolkata is also offering a very good Program in business analytics. 2 batches are already out. They have a very good industry connect as ICICI, PwC, Target Corporation, Spencer and a few others are the knowledge partners. They impart education on the in depth study of the business processes, Statistical techniques, Predictive modelling, SAS,R etc. People from last two batches are working in reputed analytics organisations. I also did the same course from there more that an year back. I found that a very well structured and relevant program if anyone is seeking opportunities in the field of analytics. This is an honest review not doing any promotion for that college as I was also was very much confused when I Joined 2 years back.</p>
<p><a href="http://www.praxis.ac.in" rel="nofollow">http://www.praxis.ac.in</a></p>

<p>I have seen many people are having queries related to EPBABI by IIM ranchi (as I was also in the same boat some days back).</p>
<p>Here I want to share the way to contact people who have taken this course and now they are IIM-Ranchi-EPBABI Alumni.</p>
<p>Login to your facebook account and search for EPBABI Alumni Association- IIM- Ranchi .</p>
<p>Ask your queries and talk to Alumni of IIM Ranchi EPBABI they will clarify your doubt.</p>
<p>Thanks a lot Kunal Jain for helping us.</p>

<li class="comment odd alt thread-even depth-1 parent" id="comment-1235">
<div id="div-comment-1235" class="comment-body">
<div class="comment-author vcard">
<img alt='' src='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/7af548c2407ae3c258b61adb8ddfee85?s=100&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g' srcset='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/7af548c2407ae3c258b61adb8ddfee85?s=200&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g 2x' class='avatar avatar-100 photo' height='100' width='100' /> <cite class="fn">Apurv</cite> <span class="says">says:</span> </div>
<div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2013/07/advanced-analytics-certifications/#comment-1235">
November 12, 2013 at 9:00 am</a> </div>
<p>Hello Kunal,</p>
<p>I have been shortlisted for the IIM-R EPBABI programme but im kinda confused because of two reasons:<br />
1. The course is relatively new and fee is a lil high.<br />
2. Iv heard they focus more on theory and a lil less of software exposure which I think is crucial in landing a job in this industry. </p>
<p>I have 2 years of exp in supply chain mgt, and my job focuses on reporting using Ms Excel.<br />
I live in Bangalore and have heard a lot about an institute named Jigsaw Academy , their course content rocks good and faculty exp is rock solid. I actually had planned on taking up a basic foundation course in analystics from Jigsaw.<br />
In the men while I applied for IIM-R and got selected, Im all confused now which course to take up since the fee in Jigsaw is around 46K only. </p>
<p>The founder and the faculty of Jigsaw have been roped by Great lakes Institute of Mgt for the 1 year programme in Analytics they have recently started, which indicates that they are definitely good .</p>
<p>I have asked a couple of people who had taken up the course from Jigsaw, they all said course is really good as they deal with optimum amount of theory and more on case studies using tools that they teach. </p>
<p>So now the big question for me is which among the two do i select</p>
<p>JIGSAW ACADEMY or IIM-R ( Honestly specking i wanna go for IIM-R because of the brand name, although m skeptic about software tool exposure)</p>
<p>Experts please help asap&#8230;..coz I have like only 14 days left to make the payment for IIM-R if I wanna take up analytics there.</p>
<p>Please kindly help me&#8230;.</p>

<p>I meant Great Lakes is better brand than Jigsaw. This would be second or third batch for Great Lakes as well. I know a couple of students who are currently undergoing the curriculam.</p>
<p>IIM-R is equivalent / slightly better brand, but lately, they have been relatively liberal with their intake of student. Going by their selections, I don&#8217;t think they expect analytics experience in the candidates.</p>

November 13, 2013 at 6:59 pm</a> </div>
<p>Hari,</p>
<p>The course might have limited short term impact of your current career. However, they are related industries and I expect Analytics to create differentiation for a lot of applications. Read <a href="http://yourstory.com/2013/10/medine-food-app/#!" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">this</a> story for example, so the course will have long term benefits.</p>
<p>I don&#8217;t think switching after investing 10 years in a field is a great idea, when the field itself presents opportunities.</p>
<p>Kunal</p>

November 13, 2013 at 7:51 am</a> </div>
<p>Hello Kunal</p>
<p>I am B.E.(Computer Science) and MBA( Marketing&amp; Systems).I have around 4 years of Sales &amp; Marketing experience in world&#8217;s biggest battery manufacturing company.I want to shift my career to Business Analytics. I have following queries.<br />
1.Since i have sales and marketing experience and don&#8217;t have any software and programming experience.If i switch my career to analytic fields, will it be beneficial?<br />
2.ISB or Great Lakes Gurgaon for business analytics course (I live in delhi)?<br />
3.As i am planning to do this course next year. In the meantime should i try to learn SAS?<br />
4.What are my chances of getting job as a business analyst after completing course?</p>
<p>Thanks<br />
Abhishek</p>
<div class="reply"><a rel='nofollow' class='comment-reply-link' href='#comment-1318' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "div-comment-1318", "1318", "respond", "293" )' aria-label='Reply to Abhishek Gupta'>Reply</a></div>

<ul class="children">
<li class="comment byuser comment-author-kunalj bypostauthor odd alt depth-2" id="comment-1342">
<div id="div-comment-1342" class="comment-body">
<div class="comment-author vcard">
<img alt='' src='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=100&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g' srcset='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=200&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g 2x' class='avatar avatar-100 photo' height='100' width='100' /> <cite class="fn"><a href='http://www.analyticsvidhya.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Kunal Jain</a></cite> <span class="says">says:</span> </div>
<div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2013/07/advanced-analytics-certifications/#comment-1342">
November 13, 2013 at 6:54 pm</a> </div>
<p>Abhishek,</p>
<p>Here you go:</p>
<p>1. Your experience will help you become a better business analyst. However, it would not get counted as relevant work experience (unless you have done some strategic projects basis data and numbers).</p>
<p>2. ISB for better content, bigger brand and industry exposure. Please read my reply to Dheeraj for more details.</p>
<p>3. You can. However, I would focus more on learning concepts rather than tools. Go through some of the courses on Coursera mentioned in this <a href="http://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2013/10/analytics-training-recommendations/" title="Analytics training recommendations from last 2 months" rel="nofollow"></a>article.</p>
<p>4. The industry is short of good talent and companies are looking out for people from premier institutes. However, lack of organized placements and relatively short term of the course makes it difficult to put any numbers on placements. The chances would be as good as your efforts and knowledge you earned during the course.</p>
<p>Thanks,<br />
Kunal</p>
<div class="reply"><a rel='nofollow' class='comment-reply-link' href='#comment-1342' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "div-comment-1342", "1342", "respond", "293" )' aria-label='Reply to Kunal Jain'>Reply</a></div>

You can go through following <a href="http://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2013/10/analytics-training-recommendations/" title="Analytics training recommendations from last 2 months" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">recommendations</a>.</p>
<p>Machine Learning course is a good place to start.</p>
<p>Thanks,<br />
Kunal</p>

<p>Vikesh,</p>
<p>FRM would add more credibility to your CV, but it is not mandatory to get a job in risk analytics.</p>
<p>I am not aware of any such requirement (mandatory MBA) for FRM.</p>
<p>Thanks,<br />
Kunal</p>

<p>Arun,</p>
<p>The exam tests you on Data interpretation and logical reasoning. The best way to prepare would be to use reference material / preparation material for CAT and solve the relevant sections.</p>
<p>The more you practice, the better it would be.</p>
<p>Thanks,<br />
Kunal</p>

<p>Hi Kunal</p>
<p>This is Ganesh here. I hope you will be able to give me good guidance and clear some of my doubts. I am a B. Pharm grad working as a Quality Analyst in a BPO (medical transcription, billing, coding). I have a total experience of 13 years in this field. I am thinking about a career shift to Analytics and have joined the foundation course at Jigsaw. I have two questions to ask you. #1) At age 36, is it too late to contemplate a career change to Analytics. Is it worth trying for me. #2) If I can, what other courses will help me to have a good entry into this career. I have good clinical/medical domain knowledge with my 13 years of experience.</p>
<p>Please reply and thanks in advance.</p>

<li class="comment byuser comment-author-kunalj bypostauthor even depth-2 parent" id="comment-3856">
<div id="div-comment-3856" class="comment-body">
<div class="comment-author vcard">
<img alt='' src='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=100&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g' srcset='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=200&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g 2x' class='avatar avatar-100 photo' height='100' width='100' /> <cite class="fn"><a href='http://www.analyticsvidhya.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Kunal Jain</a></cite> <span class="says">says:</span> </div>
<div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2013/07/advanced-analytics-certifications/#comment-3856">
December 11, 2013 at 6:30 pm</a> </div>
<p>Ganesh,</p>
<p>Here are my views on your questions:</p>
<p>1. It is never late for a change as long as you are doing it for the right reasons. However, you will lose the benefit of work experience and start afresh, which might make it difficult to change.</p>
<p>2. If I was in your place, I would have tried for an opportunity in Clinical Analysis. It fits with your education and experience. You can look out for courses in this domain. Coursera is a good place to start.</p>
<p>Thanks,<br />
Kunal</p>

<li class="comment byuser comment-author-kunalj bypostauthor even depth-4" id="comment-3944">
<div id="div-comment-3944" class="comment-body">
<div class="comment-author vcard">
<img alt='' src='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=100&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g' srcset='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=200&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g 2x' class='avatar avatar-100 photo' height='100' width='100' /> <cite class="fn"><a href='http://www.analyticsvidhya.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Kunal Jain</a></cite> <span class="says">says:</span> </div>
<div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2013/07/advanced-analytics-certifications/#comment-3944">
December 18, 2013 at 7:16 pm</a> </div>
<p>Ganesh,</p>
<p>Yeah, Clinical Analysis and Analytics typically refer to same field. Knowledge about statistics hypothesis testing, A/B testing, DOE are must for clinical trials and analysis. Most of the jobs in India in this domain would be for US clients (in KPOs).</p>
<p>Stats courses are good place to start.</p>
<p>Thanks,<br />
Kunal</p>
<div class="reply"><a rel='nofollow' class='comment-reply-link' href='#comment-3944' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "div-comment-3944", "3944", "respond", "293" )' aria-label='Reply to Kunal Jain'>Reply</a></div>
</div>

<div id="div-comment-3855" class="comment-body">
<div class="comment-author vcard">
<img alt='' src='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=100&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g' srcset='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=200&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g 2x' class='avatar avatar-100 photo' height='100' width='100' /> <cite class="fn"><a href='http://www.analyticsvidhya.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Kunal Jain</a></cite> <span class="says">says:</span> </div>
<div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2013/07/advanced-analytics-certifications/#comment-3855">
December 11, 2013 at 6:25 pm</a> </div>
<p>Saurabh,</p>
<p>A data scientist should have good knowledge about following domains:<br />
1. Programming<br />
2. Data management<br />
3. Analytics &#038; Statistics</p>
<p>Since you already have experience with the first 2, you should aim for a course which gives maximum benefit in third domain. There are various courses in US which might fit the bill. You can check out details on KDnuggets.com for more details. The most advanced intensive course which I have seen in run by Zipfian Academy. You can check that out as well.</p>
<p>As far as the jobs are concerned, US would be a bigger market for top end data scientists. However, that might change in time to come.</p>
<p>Thanks,<br />
Kunal</p>

<p>Hi Kunal,</p>
<p>I checked Zipfian Academy&#8217;s website and their course structure etc however it seems they do not offer a MS course. I am looking to go for a MS in data science/Analytics.</p>
<p>I checked on KDnuggets.com and did some research on listed universities and their courses. I was impressed with few universities and their course structure however I cannot finalize any.</p>
<p>Could you please guide me on some really good MS courses in US with good course content.</p>
<p>I came across a university named Illinois institute of technology, Chicago ranked close to 200 in US. They have included a MS in Data Science course starting 2013. They have relatively low fees (~$20,000) and good course work with research options.</p>
<p>Is it worth doing for my profile? Or you suggest I should apply for some other better ranked universities like NorthWestern, carnegie mellon, Louisiana state university etc. </p>
<p>I understand that it is really tough to get into these universities.</p>
<p>Regards,<br />
Saurabh</p>

Kunal</p>

<ul class="children">
<li class="comment byuser comment-author-kunalj bypostauthor even depth-2" id="comment-4022">
<div id="div-comment-4022" class="comment-body">
<div class="comment-author vcard">
<img alt='' src='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=100&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g' srcset='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=200&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g 2x' class='avatar avatar-100 photo' height='100' width='100' /> <cite class="fn"><a href='http://www.analyticsvidhya.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Kunal Jain</a></cite> <span class="says">says:</span> </div>
<div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2013/07/advanced-analytics-certifications/#comment-4022">
December 24, 2013 at 3:27 pm</a> </div>
<p>Abhishek,</p>
<p>Given your work experience, there are multiple ways I can think of:</p>
<p>1. Look out for an internal job transfer in case your company also has an analytics practice.</p>
<p>2. Try out the course from ISB. Since it has started recently, I can not comment on the placements. But out of current offerings, it is the best course.</p>
<p>Thanks,<br />
Kunal</p>

<p>Abhishek,</p>
<p>I think your best bet is to contact Hughes education directly. I will answer whatever I can:</p>
<p>1. They used to focus mainly on MATLAB in past. I am not sure which tool they are using currently.<br />
2. They have a mix of examples / case studies across sectors 9including capital markets, marketing, segmentation etc.)<br />
3. They conduct webinars on set time and ask you to come to campus for a short duration. I haven&#8217;t seen the study material.<br />
4. This keeps changing. Best to check it with Hughes directly.</p>
<p>Thanks,<br />
Kunal</p>

what is the difference between &#8220;econometrics&#8221; and &#8220;data science&#8221; ?<br />
Because IIT course seems more on econometrics side than data science.</p>
<p>Thanks in advance.</p>
<p>Regards,<br />

<li class="comment byuser comment-author-kunalj bypostauthor even depth-2 parent" id="comment-4106">
<div id="div-comment-4106" class="comment-body">
<div class="comment-author vcard">
<img alt='' src='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=100&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g' srcset='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=200&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g 2x' class='avatar avatar-100 photo' height='100' width='100' /> <cite class="fn"><a href='http://www.analyticsvidhya.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Kunal Jain</a></cite> <span class="says">says:</span> </div>
<div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2013/07/advanced-analytics-certifications/#comment-4106">
January 2, 2014 at 11:03 am</a> </div>
<p>While there is a huge overlap in the study material, the focus is on different applications. For example, Econometrics would typically focus more on things like macro-economic forecasts. Data science is a more broader term, which would include studying customer behaviour and taking decisions basis data.</p>
<p>Hopefully, this answers the question.</p>
<p>Thanks,<br />
Kunal</p>
<p>Thanks,<br />
Kunal</p>

<p>Harish,</p>
<p>Following is my take on your questions:</p>
<p>1. Idea of adding a masters is good. However, this degree from NIIT may not be considered at par with masters currently.<br />
2. It would be a good shift if you can get a good lateral opportunity. That typically depends on openings / structure of your current employer. If you want to look for opportunities outside, your current work ex will be discounted.<br />
3. I would have waited to see a batch pass out and then take a call.</p>
<p>Thanks,<br />
Kunal</p>

<p>Kunal,</p>
<p>Jigsaw offers one of the better courses available as of today. Even though the interaction might be limited, the content and industry connect is better. As of now, I am not aware of any institute providing placement support.</p>
<p>If you want to go through instructor led course, have a look at ISB offering as well.</p>

Kunal</p>

<li class="comment even thread-odd thread-alt depth-1" id="comment-4201">

<li class="comment byuser comment-author-kunalj bypostauthor odd alt depth-2" id="comment-4236">
<div id="div-comment-4236" class="comment-body">
<div class="comment-author vcard">
<img alt='' src='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=100&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g' srcset='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=200&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g 2x' class='avatar avatar-100 photo' height='100' width='100' /> <cite class="fn"><a href='http://www.analyticsvidhya.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Kunal Jain</a></cite> <span class="says">says:</span> </div>
<div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2013/07/advanced-analytics-certifications/#comment-4236">
January 20, 2014 at 7:52 pm</a> </div>
<p>Kumar,</p>
<p>The course from ISB is one of the best course available in India as of now. While it does not provide a placement support, it is only a matter of time before people get picked up. </p>
<p>It is difficult to establish ROI at this stage since it is a course in early stage. However, given ISB brand, tie-up with SAS and Biocon, you can expect some good options. However, you will need to rely on your network and lateral hiring for now.</p>
<p>Thanks,<br />
Kunal</p>

<div class="comment-author vcard">
<img alt='' src='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=100&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g' srcset='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=200&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g 2x' class='avatar avatar-100 photo' height='100' width='100' /> <cite class="fn"><a href='http://www.analyticsvidhya.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Kunal Jain</a></cite> <span class="says">says:</span> </div>
<div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2013/07/advanced-analytics-certifications/#comment-4238">
January 20, 2014 at 7:59 pm</a> </div>
<p>Hi Surya,</p>
<p>Congrats for the selection. The course from ISB is one of the best in the industry. Following is the approach I would take:</p>
<p>1. How much experience do you currently have? How much do you expect to earn in coming 5 years?<br />
2. By investing 5 Lacs in this course, it is reasonable to expect that you would be able to get starting jobs in advanced Analytics industry. Project the earnings in this scenario.</p>
<p>Compare the two and take a decision for yourself.</p>
<p>Thanks,<br />
Kunal</p>

<div id="div-comment-4260" class="comment-body">
<div class="comment-author vcard">
<img alt='' src='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/6870329f1a23ba7c4b6c9bac2e9af51b?s=100&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g' srcset='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/6870329f1a23ba7c4b6c9bac2e9af51b?s=200&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g 2x' class='avatar avatar-100 photo' height='100' width='100' /> <cite class="fn">Neeraj</cite> <span class="says">says:</span> </div>
<div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2013/07/advanced-analytics-certifications/#comment-4260">
January 24, 2014 at 8:54 am</a> </div>
<p>Hi Kunal,</p>
<p>I have around 11 years of IT experience. 5 Years in Database technology and rest 6 years in business intelligence (MSBI). I have been with premier organizations (Syntel, Microsoft, CSC). I am also an EMC certified data science associate professional. I am also a part of Big data analytics group run by CSC.<br />
I have got an offer for doing (CBA) Analytics course from ISB.</p>
<p>After having such enritched IT experiecne, whether I should go ahead and do this course (considering such a huge investment at this stage of life). or I should try some other mean to gain the knowledge. Is it necessary to have analytics certificate to become a data scientist or a person can become a data scientist based on his passion after learning data science by itself. </p>
<p>Please suggest.</p>
<div class="reply"><a rel='nofollow' class='comment-reply-link' href='#comment-4260' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "div-comment-4260", "4260", "respond", "293" )' aria-label='Reply to Neeraj'>Reply</a></div>

<ul class="children">
<li class="comment byuser comment-author-kunalj bypostauthor even depth-2" id="comment-4314">
<div id="div-comment-4314" class="comment-body">
<div class="comment-author vcard">
<img alt='' src='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=100&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g' srcset='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=200&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g 2x' class='avatar avatar-100 photo' height='100' width='100' /> <cite class="fn"><a href='http://www.analyticsvidhya.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Kunal Jain</a></cite> <span class="says">says:</span> </div>
<div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2013/07/advanced-analytics-certifications/#comment-4314">
January 27, 2014 at 7:05 pm</a> </div>
<p>Neeraj,</p>
<p>There is no necessity o a certification in case you get a break through in the industry. If you can get a break through into a good role, on job training is usually far more effective. I myself have not undergone formal certification for Analytics.</p>
<p>If you don&#8217;t have an offer for a relevant position in data science, you should consider how easy or difficult it would be for you and compare it against the resources and time you will spend for ISB certification (and the chances of getting a relevant job ater the course).</p>
<p>Hope it helps.</p>
<p>Thanks,<br />
Kunal</p>
<div class="reply"><a rel='nofollow' class='comment-reply-link' href='#comment-4314' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "div-comment-4314", "4314", "respond", "293" )' aria-label='Reply to Kunal Jain'>Reply</a></div>
</div>

<li class="comment byuser comment-author-kunalj bypostauthor odd alt depth-2 parent" id="comment-4361">
<div id="div-comment-4361" class="comment-body">
<div class="comment-author vcard">
<img alt='' src='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=100&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g' srcset='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=200&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g 2x' class='avatar avatar-100 photo' height='100' width='100' /> <cite class="fn"><a href='http://www.analyticsvidhya.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Kunal Jain</a></cite> <span class="says">says:</span> </div>
<div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2013/07/advanced-analytics-certifications/#comment-4361">
February 1, 2014 at 10:39 am</a> </div>
<p>Shrikanth,</p>
<p>Answering this question generically would be too long and might not answer your question. If you can provide more details on some of the aspects, I might suggest some thing more relevant to you:</p>
<p>1. Which technologies have you worked on?<br />
2. How much of your role is business users facing?<br />
3. How much time and resources can you devote to learning analytics?<br />
4. What is the time frame in which you would want to switch your career to Analytics?<br />
5. Depending on your work ex, you may have to start as a fresher in this industry. Will you be comfortable in that situation?</p>
<p>Thanks,<br />
Kunal</p>

<div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2013/07/advanced-analytics-certifications/#comment-4371">
February 3, 2014 at 2:38 pm</a> </div>
<p>Kunal<br />
Thanks for your reply. Please refer below.</p>
<p>1. Which technologies have you worked on?<br />
Answer :- Pl/sql, Sql.<br />
2. How much of your role is business users facing?<br />
Answer :- I am in a customer facing role, so it&#8217;s a day-in day-out job responding to business needs of customer and application users as well.<br />
3. How much time and resources can you devote to learning analytics?<br />
Answer :- I am ready to study for a year in analytics area and spend my savings as well.<br />
4. What is the time frame in which you would want to switch your career to Analytics?<br />
Answer :- In next 1-2 years.<br />
5. Depending on your work ex, you may have to start as a fresher in this industry. Will you be comfortable in that situation?<br />
Answer :- I think IT Services industry could offer me analytics jobs. What do you suggest?</p>
<p>Regds<br />
Shrikant.</p>

<li class="comment even depth-2 parent" id="comment-5720">
<div id="div-comment-5720" class="comment-body">
<div class="comment-author vcard">
<img alt='' src='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/b25e0d6be46d2c58aa1856196e136709?s=100&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g' srcset='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/b25e0d6be46d2c58aa1856196e136709?s=200&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g 2x' class='avatar avatar-100 photo' height='100' width='100' /> <cite class="fn">Venu</cite> <span class="says">says:</span> </div>
<div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2013/07/advanced-analytics-certifications/#comment-5720">
April 19, 2014 at 9:23 am</a> </div>
<p>As I can see from the message board that few people were asking about NIIT&#8217;s business analytics program. I can assure everyone not to attend this course. Because, I joined the course and then I left midway when I realised that it&#8217;s a wastage of money. I can share my experience with all of you. </p>
<p>First, this program is really awful with respect to the current business analytics demand. Second, NIIT advertises some faculties and almost all of them do not take the course viz. Debasish Roy is no more attached with this program, Nidhan Choudhury lives in US and he won&#8217;t take any class ever, Sudhir Mallick is an old hat who struggles and stumbles at every part of teaching, Shyam Karmakar comes rarely and he takes Excel course ! Two folks from TCS, Tathagata Mukhopadhyay (TM) and Goutam Das (GD) are awfully junk. TM hardly has knowledge some basic statistics and his teaching &amp; communication skill is horrible. GD is an empty vessel ! </p>
<p>Lastly, the money that NIIT charges with respect to this current environment is ridiculous. So I&#8217;d strongly recommend not to attend this course. Then you&#8217;d waste your hard earned money.</p>

<p>Satya,</p>
<p>Typical salaries for freshers entering advanced analytics domain start from 6L onwards and can be as high as 12L on the outer side.</p>
<p>However, the course from Great Lakes is relatively new and might not be able to offer similar placements. You should check it with them directly. On the other hand, you can also check the course from ISB.</p>
<p>Thanks,<br />
Kunal</p>

<p>Hi Kunal,</p>
<p>I am an IT Business Analyst with 3+ years of professional exp. Prior to this I have a bachelors degree in Elect Engg. I&#8217;ve worked with TCS and ING Life. My domain specialization lies in Insurance, Superannuation and Banking.<br />
I enrolled with an institute for a course in Business Analytics last year. Although I got some hands-on in SAS, SPSS and some statistical techniques , but the course &amp; learning was insufficient for further carrer opportunities.<br />
I appeared for some interviews but most of the roles were around data analysis, consulting. I am looking for something into pure analytics with domain exposure.</p>
<p>1. Can you help me by suggesting some courses which will prepare me for the role I am looking for?<br />
2. Is an MS degree required for getting a job in the role I am looking for?<br />
3. Also, let me know if my profile is suitable for acceptance to MS degree programs in US, given the fact I have little or no technical work-ex?<br />
Requesting guidance from your side&#8230;</p>

<img alt='' src='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=100&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g' srcset='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=200&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g 2x' class='avatar avatar-100 photo' height='100' width='100' /> <cite class="fn"><a href='http://www.analyticsvidhya.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Kunal Jain</a></cite> <span class="says">says:</span> </div>

February 23, 2014 at 8:34 am</a> </div>
<p>Aritra,</p>
<p>You can also see if some analytics consultancies can offer you a relevant role. It is typically easy to move internally in these Organizations as they are very dynamic in nature and work on diverse set of problems.</p>
<p>Here are answers to specific questions:</p>
<p>1. Given your work experience, the course from ISB might be the best fit. In the meanwhile, you can continue to go through courses on Coursera.</p>
<p>2. It is not necessary, but might be a good way to enter the domain</p>
<p>3. I think profile fit would not be a challenge. However, this varies from college to college.</p>
<p>Thanks,<br />
Kunal</p>

<li class="comment even thread-odd thread-alt depth-1 parent" id="comment-4497">
<div id="div-comment-4497" class="comment-body">
<div class="comment-author vcard">
<img alt='' src='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/c9c50ba2a6561d9b643956103000d62b?s=100&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g' srcset='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/c9c50ba2a6561d9b643956103000d62b?s=200&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g 2x' class='avatar avatar-100 photo' height='100' width='100' /> <cite class="fn">Chandra Sekhar</cite> <span class="says">says:</span> </div>
<div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2013/07/advanced-analytics-certifications/#comment-4497">
February 20, 2014 at 6:41 pm</a> </div>
<p>Dear friends ,</p>
<p>I observed all your comments . </p>
<p>I suggest you few points those who are in IT development or functional rolls are in career transition into Business analytics </p>
<p>&#8212; Business analytics is not for freshers but it’s for experienced techno functional candidates<br />
Companies recruit only IIS or ISI or MSc stats graduates from premier schools only<br />
Some fake training institutes misguide even freshers are also eligible can join .. don’t trust them . </p>
<p>-It not only needs technical skills but also needs management subjects like business, economic , statistics, finance, HR ,marketing, operations management and SCM<br />
If you have MBA or MSc statistics that would be great </p>
<p>&#8211;must have excellent communication skills<br />
You need to give presentations to stake holders or C level managers </p>
<p>&#8211;do market survey on salary, designation, experience on BA before join the course .<br />
If your years of experience is not fulfilling market salary you won’t able to get rich salary in short duration by doing new course, you will again start new salary and new career . It just enhance those who are in similar field .</p>
<p>My Profile : </p>
<p>Since 8 years I have been recruiting plethora of technical candidates for US and Canada locations for fortune clients</p>

<li class="comment byuser comment-author-kunalj bypostauthor odd alt depth-2" id="comment-4514">
<div id="div-comment-4514" class="comment-body">
<div class="comment-author vcard">
<img alt='' src='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=100&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g' srcset='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=200&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g 2x' class='avatar avatar-100 photo' height='100' width='100' /> <cite class="fn"><a href='http://www.analyticsvidhya.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Kunal Jain</a></cite> <span class="says">says:</span> </div>
<div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2013/07/advanced-analytics-certifications/#comment-4514">
February 23, 2014 at 2:22 am</a> </div>
<p>Thanks Chandra for sharing your perspective. While some of the things you have mentioned are hard realities about the industry, I don&#8217;t agree entirely with the point you mentioned on only IIS or ISI getting fresher placements.</p>
<p>A lot of companies have started going to institutes beyond ISI. IITs see ~30% placement with Analytics firms and so do some NITs as well. IIMs and top 20 MBA colleges also see good placement in Analytics companies.</p>
<p>Also, a lot of start-ups are now moving to big data infrastructure from the start, which will further increase the penetration of these jobs. Even though rare, I know people from non-premier institutes who are doing well in the sector.</p>
<p>Regards,<br />
Kunal</p>

<p>Avishek,</p>
<p>IIT Delhi runs a course which can be of your interest as well. While there are other options (e.g. NIIT has also started a course on BA and there are other boutique institutes running the course), these 2 courses are the best for classroom training. You can also look at the training provided by the SAS institute (although it would be only on SAS).</p>
<p>Thanks,<br />
Kunal</p>

March 1, 2014 at 8:35 pm</a> </div>
<p>Hi Punit,</p>
<p>Here are my answers:</p>
<p>1. not sure which course you are referring to here. Please let me know and I will answer accordingly.<br />
2. Online programme has its own advantage and dis-advantage. Advantage is the flexibility it provides (specially for working professionals, like you and me). Disadvantage is that you do not get the entire ecosystem.<br />
3. The courses you are referring to have different course content. The right choice depends on what you want. Since I am not sure what do you want, it is difficult to provide right advice.</p>
<p>Thanks,<br />
Kunal</p>

<p>Navin,</p>
<p>Analytics is a very specific skill set and might be difficult to learn / develop after working for 11 years. Also, it would be difficult to get a job only on basis of these courses as none of them provide any placement support.</p>
<p>Regards,<br />
Kunal</p>

<p>Vibin,</p>
<p>Typical salaries in Analytics industry (for freshers) range from 5L p.a. &#8211; 12L p.a.</p>
<p>I would recommend to manage your course alongside your job, if you can manage. That way you can take your time to find the right job rather than taking up any analytics job which comes your way.</p>
<p>Regards,<br />
Kunal</p>

March 2, 2014 at 7:05 am</a> </div>
<p>Nitesh,</p>
<p>Here are answers to your queries:</p>
<p>1. These institutes are gaining recognition with time. I would say that you should expect good knowledge gain and some chances of getting a job. It would be difficult to get a job only on the basis on this certification.</p>
<p>2. Already answered</p>
<p>3. BI includes dashbaording and answering what has already happened. BA on the other hand could be detective and predictive analytics. Refer to <a href="http://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2013/06/business-analytics-spectrum/" title="What is Business Analytics and which tools are used for analysis?" rel="nofollow">this article</a> for more details</p>

In my current job i manage an MIS + Planning team for a Call Centre that looks after the performance reporting / analysis, forecasting call volumes and hiring requirements for multiple lines of business.<br />
However all of this is done on excel.</p>
<p>My current role puts me into the senior management category (10+ years of experience) that looks after a team of 50+.<br />
I wanted to upgrade my skillset in Analytics for future growth prospects.<br />
For that i was considering doing one of the below courses.</p>
<p>1) Executive Program in Business Analytics from IIM-C<br />
2) Advanced Certificate Program in Business Analytics &#8211; IIM-B</p>

<p>Ken,</p>
<p>None of the two courses are aimed towards leadership role in Analytics. They are for people who want to start their career in analytics. There might be more relevant leadership courses from institutes outside India, which might be more relevant.</p>
<p>You can start looking at KDNuggets.com to start with.</p>
<p>Thanks,<br />
Kunal</p>

<li class="comment byuser comment-author-kunalj bypostauthor even depth-4 parent" id="comment-4708">
<div id="div-comment-4708" class="comment-body">
<div class="comment-author vcard">
<img alt='' src='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=100&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g' srcset='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=200&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g 2x' class='avatar avatar-100 photo' height='100' width='100' /> <cite class="fn"><a href='http://www.analyticsvidhya.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Kunal Jain</a></cite> <span class="says">says:</span> </div>
<div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2013/07/advanced-analytics-certifications/#comment-4708">
March 9, 2014 at 2:01 pm</a> </div>
<p>Ken,</p>
<p>I didn&#8217;t mean that you would not require know how of these techniques. The minimum you would need is a fine understanding of how these platforms work, their limitations and strengths. But this is very different form having hands on experience on them. Any thing more than this this understanding is better and beneficial.</p>
<p>If you can get some hands on experience, that is good. But taking up a hands on role might not be the best thing for some one in your shoes. There are leadership roles available in several Organization where good high level understanding might be good enough to give a break. You might need to search a bit!</p>
<p>Hope this helps.</p>
<p>Kunal</p>

<li class="comment byuser comment-author-kunalj bypostauthor odd alt depth-2" id="comment-4616">

<div class="comment-author vcard">
<img alt='' src='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=100&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g' srcset='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=200&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g 2x' class='avatar avatar-100 photo' height='100' width='100' /> <cite class="fn"><a href='http://www.analyticsvidhya.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Kunal Jain</a></cite> <span class="says">says:</span> </div>
<div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2013/07/advanced-analytics-certifications/#comment-4616">
March 3, 2014 at 7:41 am</a> </div>
<p>Abhishek,</p>
<p>R definitely has bright future, but as of now in India, SAS holds the biggest market share. Also, it is not that easy for corporates to migrate from one tool to another. Hence, from job perspective, you will find more jobs in SAS. On the flip side, the jobs in R, have less competition.</p>
<p>I personally prefer instructor led over video as it gives you chance to clear your doubts and have higher engagement. But that is a personal preference.</p>
<p>Thanks,<br />
Kunal</p>
<div class="reply"><a rel='nofollow' class='comment-reply-link' href='#comment-4616' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "div-comment-4616", "4616", "respond", "293" )' aria-label='Reply to Kunal Jain'>Reply</a></div>

<div class="comment-author vcard">
<img alt='' src='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=100&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g' srcset='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=200&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g 2x' class='avatar avatar-100 photo' height='100' width='100' /> <cite class="fn"><a href='http://www.analyticsvidhya.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Kunal Jain</a></cite> <span class="says">says:</span> </div>
<div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2013/07/advanced-analytics-certifications/#comment-4705">
March 9, 2014 at 1:21 pm</a> </div>
<p>Anshuman,</p>
<p>With current set of options, coding has almost become good to know. SAS has a very good GUI and R also has a few good ones. So, it is not mandatory to learn coding. Having said that, if you want to become an expert, knowing coding helps a lot.</p>
<p>This is one of the reason why most of the training programmes focus on teaching coding. </p>
<p>Thanks,<br />
Kunal</p>
<div class="reply"><a rel='nofollow' class='comment-reply-link' href='#comment-4705' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "div-comment-4705", "4705", "respond", "293" )' aria-label='Reply to Kunal Jain'>Reply</a></div>

<li class="comment odd alt depth-3" id="comment-4722">
<div id="div-comment-4722" class="comment-body">
<div class="comment-author vcard">
<img alt='' src='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/c29cd5ff72272c771bf9e123084476c4?s=100&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g' srcset='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/c29cd5ff72272c771bf9e123084476c4?s=200&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g 2x' class='avatar avatar-100 photo' height='100' width='100' /> <cite class="fn">KingHorse</cite> <span class="says">says:</span> </div>
<div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2013/07/advanced-analytics-certifications/#comment-4722">
March 10, 2014 at 7:55 am</a> </div>
<p>Kunal,</p>
<p>But as we go from linear bivariate regression modelling to advance level modelling, it becomes necessary to use software tools. Advance Complicated models can&#8217;t be fit with hand made calculations or excel (It will crash).<br />
So I think understanding softwares technologies like R/SAS for data analysis is a prerequisite.<br />
Even more, if one does not know exact mathematical formulae in details but he knows interpretation of output from software for models in R/SAS, he/she will have higher market value.</p>
<p>Don&#8217;t you think so? </p>
<p>Regards,<br />
KingHorse</p>

<img alt='' src='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=100&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g' srcset='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=200&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g 2x' class='avatar avatar-100 photo' height='100' width='100' /> <cite class="fn"><a href='http://www.analyticsvidhya.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Kunal Jain</a></cite> <span class="says">says:</span> </div>
<div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2013/07/advanced-analytics-certifications/#comment-4864">
March 18, 2014 at 12:28 pm</a> </div>
<p>Shivi,</p>
<p>Thanks for your query. Given that you have already spent 4.5 years in industry with experience across multiple tools, I am not sure how much value the course from IIM Calcutta would add.</p>
<p>If your primary reason to join is to gain statistical knowledge, there are multiple good courses on Coursera you can do to learn these techniques. If you still want a brand name &#8211; you can consider doing some of the online courses from MITx. These are available online and focus on big data -> which can help you add more knowledge to your repository.</p>
<p>Regards,<br />
Kunal</p>

<p>Paritosh,</p>
<p>Your next steps depends on how determined and disciplined you are. If you are very disciplined, all the required information is available on internet in some form or other and hence you can start learning on your own.</p>
<p>If you need interventions, you can go for trainings. Full time trainings typically have better quality output.</p>
<p>Regards,<br />
Kunal</p>

<p>I am a Marketing professional with total 5 years of experience. <p>What low-mid budget course would you recommend, if any? </p>
<p>Thanks</p>

<li class="comment even thread-odd thread-alt depth-1 parent" id="comment-5442">
<div id="div-comment-5442" class="comment-body">
<div class="comment-author vcard">
<img alt='' src='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/b76d3993294e1370dbb3d9f70a609b32?s=100&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g' srcset='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/b76d3993294e1370dbb3d9f70a609b32?s=200&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g 2x' class='avatar avatar-100 photo' height='100' width='100' /> <cite class="fn">Disha</cite> <span class="says">says:</span> </div>

April 14, 2014 at 7:16 am</a> </div>
<p>Hi,</p>
<p>Firstly, excellent article and very informative.<br />
I am working with Cognizant &#8211; DW/ ETL Testing completing 3 years of experience in July 2014. I want to apply for this ISB CBA course. I have already taken GMAT and scored 660, which clears me through the Online test. I have good acads. I have few queries on the application. Can someone please help me out?</p>
<p>1. Is it too ambitious?<br />
2. Is it already late to apply, as it is clearly mentioned on the site&#8221;First cum first basis&#8221;?<br />
3. Do i have to be working during this course or i can just resign and take the course?<br />
4. I do not want to reveal about this application to my manager. How do I manage to apply?</p>
<p>Thank you in advance.</p>
<p>&#8211; Disha</p>
<div class="reply"><a rel='nofollow' class='comment-reply-link' href='#comment-5442' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "div-comment-5442", "5442", "respond", "293" )' aria-label='Reply to Disha'>Reply</a></div>

<ul class="children">
<li class="comment byuser comment-author-kunalj bypostauthor odd alt depth-2" id="comment-5478">
<div id="div-comment-5478" class="comment-body">
<div class="comment-author vcard">
<img alt='' src='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=100&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g' srcset='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=200&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g 2x' class='avatar avatar-100 photo' height='100' width='100' /> <cite class="fn"><a href='http://www.analyticsvidhya.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Kunal Jain</a></cite> <span class="says">says:</span> </div>
<div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2013/07/advanced-analytics-certifications/#comment-5478">
April 15, 2014 at 2:56 am</a> </div>
<p>Hi Disha,</p>
<p>Here are answers to your questions:</p>
<p>1. It depends on quality of your work experience. If it is good (i.e. you have differentiated yourself compared to people doing DW / ETL), then 3 years of experience might be good. Otherwise, it is slightly lower than what ISB has taken last year.</p>
<p>2. I don&#8217;t think it is late to apply. They have opened applications very recently.</p>
<p>3. It is better if you are working. More so, if you can apply what you learn to work. If you resign, you need to plan out what will you do when you are not in campus.</p>
<p>4. It is best to mention it to him. You will need holidays to attend classrooms during the year.</p>
<p>Thanks,<br />
Kunal</p>
<div class="reply"><a rel='nofollow' class='comment-reply-link' href='#comment-5478' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "div-comment-5478", "5478", "respond", "293" )' aria-label='Reply to Kunal Jain'>Reply</a></div>

<p>Akash,</p>
<p>1. Great Lakes has the second best offering amongst all other offerings in India. ISB has a better offering mainly due to the brand name.</p>
<p>2. It is difficult to answer this question because there is no generic answer. All fields in Analytics offer good growth currently (due to shortage of good resources.) Your deciding criteria should be more dependent on what you would enjoy and what you have done in past. Hope you understand what I mean.</p>
<p>Let me know if you have any other specific query.</p>
<p>Thanks,<br />
Kunal</p>

<p>1. In order to prepare for ISB entrance, you should practice solving more and more logical reasoning and probability based questions.</p>
<p>2. I am not aware of entrance exams in any other course.</p>

<li class="comment byuser comment-author-kunalj bypostauthor odd alt depth-2" id="comment-6719">
<div id="div-comment-6719" class="comment-body">
<div class="comment-author vcard">
<img alt='' src='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=100&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g' srcset='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=200&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g 2x' class='avatar avatar-100 photo' height='100' width='100' /> <cite class="fn"><a href='http://www.analyticsvidhya.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Kunal Jain</a></cite> <span class="says">says:</span> </div>
<div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2013/07/advanced-analytics-certifications/#comment-6719">
May 3, 2014 at 6:16 am</a> </div>
<p>Geetika,</p>
<p>It might be difficult to get a good role with flexibility straight away. This is because typically companies have their servers and data housed inside the company.</p>
<p>Also, because typically the work is very intense, while it happens. It requires discussions with other analysts and managers / experience people and client.</p>
<p>Once you have experience in this domain, people will be happy to provide this flexibility.</p>
<p>Regards,<br />
Kunal</p>
<div class="reply"><a rel='nofollow' class='comment-reply-link' href='#comment-6719' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "div-comment-6719", "6719", "respond", "293" )' aria-label='Reply to Kunal Jain'>Reply</a></div>
</div>

<p>Hi Kunal, I am post graduate in business analytics from PRAXIS BUSINESS SCHOOL, KOLKATA. Its the FIrst school to offer FT program in Analytics since last 4 years. ICICI BANK &amp; PWC are knowledge partners who hire directly from campus in their Analytics space. Other than that, leading companies from Banking, Telecom, Retail &amp; consulting have hired from the past. Faculty consist of eminent people from industry with more than 20-25 yrs of experience from companies like PWC, Tata-steel, HP etc.. Faculty has been teaching across IIM&#8217;s &amp; other top institutes across the country.</p>
<p> website is <a href="http://www.praxis.ac.in" rel="nofollow">http://www.praxis.ac.in</a>.</p>

<li class="comment byuser comment-author-kunalj bypostauthor odd alt depth-2" id="comment-6696">
<div id="div-comment-6696" class="comment-body">
<div class="comment-author vcard">
<img alt='' src='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=100&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g' srcset='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=200&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g 2x' class='avatar avatar-100 photo' height='100' width='100' /> <cite class="fn"><a href='http://www.analyticsvidhya.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Kunal Jain</a></cite> <span class="says">says:</span> </div>
<div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2013/07/advanced-analytics-certifications/#comment-6696">
May 3, 2014 at 4:19 am</a> </div>
<p>Chitra,</p>
<p>Since this is your first exposure to analytics, I would suggest to go for courses with wider coverage (e.g. Foundation course from Jigsaw) rather than segment specific course.</p>
<p>BA course from ISB / Great Lakes might give better chances of placements, however they come at a higher cost as well. By taking up these courses, your profile will definitely improve and the jobs in future will likely be more rewarding. However, you should first answer whether you enjoy dealing with numbers and probability? Stats? Coding?</p>
<p>If the answer to all that is yes, you should pursue a few courses from Coursera to get a flavour of industry. Machine Learning from Stanford University, Data Science track by John Hopkins University are some of the best places to start.</p>
<p>Hope this helps.</p>
<p>Kunal</p>
<div class="reply"><a rel='nofollow' class='comment-reply-link' href='#comment-6696' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "div-comment-6696", "6696", "respond", "293" )' aria-label='Reply to Kunal Jain'>Reply</a></div>
</div>
</li>
</ul>

<p>Hi Kunal,</p>
<p>First of all, we (all who wants to grab a profile in BA/BI) are really grateful to you to create a space for us where we can put our query, comments and share our views. </p>
<p>I have around 5.5 years of experience in different fields like Retail, Market Research and now telecom,however, the role is into analysis. I did my MSc in Economics (Stat as optional) and MBA in Marketing and like to work on analysis. I have knowledge on regression, correlation, hypothesis, time series data analysis, but without in depth work experience, these are useless. However, I didn&#8217;t get an opportunity to learn analysis like Regression, Hypothesis, Time Series Data analysis in depth and that&#8217;s why rejected in interviews for the profile of analytics in big companies like Capgemini, iGate etc. They want in depth work knowledge in Regression, ARIMA, Conjoint analysis etc and also knowledge of statistical tools like SAS, R etc. I have work experience in SPSS but not on those critical statistical analysis. Now, I think, it&#8217;s high time to learn these analysis to grow further, else, I will not get a good job in analytical profile in big companies.</p>
<p>Please suggest me a course that will help me to learn and then get an exposure in the field of analytics. </p>
<p>I have gone through all the above mentioned courses, however, money is matter for me. I can afford max to max a course fee like IIM Ranchi- EPBABI course..below that, will be better for me.</p>
<p>I am also afraid of the things that after completing the course, in case I didn&#8217;t get a job in analytics, I will forget the technique of using those statistical analysis in real business problem. Therefore, all money invest to learn will be in vain.</p>
<p>Really need your suggestion&#8230;..</p>
<div class="reply"><a rel='nofollow' class='comment-reply-link' href='#comment-7215' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "div-comment-7215", "7215", "respond", "293" )' aria-label='Reply to Arnab Dutta'>Reply</a></div>
