<li class="comment byuser comment-author-kunalj bypostauthor odd alt depth-2" id="comment-7829">
<div id="div-comment-7829" class="comment-body">
<div class="comment-author vcard">
<img alt='' src='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=100&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g' srcset='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=200&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g 2x' class='avatar avatar-100 photo' height='100' width='100' /> <cite class="fn"><a href='http://www.analyticsvidhya.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Kunal Jain</a></cite> <span class="says">says:</span> </div>
<div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2013/07/advanced-analytics-certifications/#comment-7829">
May 13, 2014 at 1:46 pm</a> </div>
<p>Arnab,</p>
<p>First things first, you are in a lot better place compared to a lot of people who want to make a switch to analytics. If I was in your place, I would first get a good grasp on all the required statistical concepts &#038; basics of R. There are some free courses on Coursera / eDX which would help you do so. So enroll for them. Look for data science specialization from John Hopkins University</p>
<p>Once you are done with the basics, I would suggest that you can start participating in a few data science competitions (e.g. on Kaggle,com) to put some of these concepts into real world testing. This way you can invest in training at a low cost and get up the curve fast.</p>
<p>Thanks,<br />
Kunal</p>
<div class="reply"><a rel='nofollow' class='comment-reply-link' href='#comment-7829' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "div-comment-7829", "7829", "respond", "293" )' aria-label='Reply to Kunal Jain'>Reply</a></div>
</div>
</li>
</ul>

May 13, 2014 at 1:26 pm</a> </div>
<p>Ravi,</p>
<p>I am currently answering all the comments once in a week (so that I can continue to focus on adding more and more value to the readers). This is the reason for the delay in response.</p>
<p>You should read <a href="http://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2014/05/planning-late-career-shift-analytics-big-data-prepared/" title="Planning a late career shift to Analytics / Big data? Better be prepared!" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">this article</a> I have posted for experienced people making a switch to analytics.</p>
<p>Here are your answers:</p>
<p>1. Start by taking a few courses on Coursera to start with. This should give you a good introduction to the domain.</p>
<p>2. All the 3 courses you mentioned are good for a beginner.</p>
<p>3. I would suggest that you take up one of the 3 courses mentioned above.</p>
<p>4. Depends on what area you start your venture.</p>
<p>Regards,<br />
Kunal</p>

<p>Hi Kunal,</p>
<p>I am a CA and having 6 yrs experience in Banking- credit risk and operational risk. Now I have been selected for IIM Bangalore &#8216;s analytics program.<br />
Pl suggest from the point of view of placements the ranking in industry of this program from IIM Banglore. I applied for ISB as well however wasn&#8217;t selected.<br />
As such i am average in statistics and a layman in this field.<br />
How would my existing domain knowledge be valued post completion of this program.</p>

<p>Vinita,</p>
<p>I am hoping that you would have had fair bit of experience with stats while managing credit risk for the bank.</p>
<p>What are your expectations from a certification programme? What would you want to achieve post completion of the programme?</p>
<p>Also, you might be average right now. More important question is, how motivated you are to learn / improve Stats and Probability? You can have a look at the <a href="http://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2014/05/planning-late-career-shift-analytics-big-data-prepared/" title="Planning a late career shift to Analytics / Big data? Better be prepared!" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">last article</a> I wrote for some more thoughts.</p>
<p>Thanks,<br />
Kunal</p>

<p>I&#8217;m aware of NIIT course and their current faculties. Their analytic program is awful. So I strongly suggested not to join their program at all in case you care of your money, time, knowledge etc. </p>
<p>Now to answer where you can learn analytic course &#8211; there are some avenues as suggested by Kunal Jain at several places in his message board. Please go through. If you want to learn some computational tools you can learn R and Python by yourself, at least at some extent.</p>
<p>HTH.</p>

<p>Tarun,</p>
<p>My advice would be to look for a few other options. ISI would start their first batch soon. Not sure if the information is available on their site yet. NIIT has received mixed reviews.</p>
<p>If you are looking for a certification from MBA institutes, you can consider ISB / Jigsaw. From other institutes, you can check out Jigsaw Academy.</p>

Kunal</p>

<div class="comment-author vcard">

<div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2013/07/advanced-analytics-certifications/#comment-8738">
May 22, 2014 at 3:38 am</a> </div>
<p>Arjun,</p>
<p>Thanks for your question. It is difficult to answer the question generically. It depends a lot on case to case basis. For example, what has been your experience before the courses? What do you want to achieve after the course?</p>
<p>Courses from MBA institutes and institutes like Edvancer / Jigsaw are 2 different value propositions. I know of people who got jobs after both of them.</p>
<p>Regards,<br />
Kunal</p>

<li class="comment even thread-even depth-1 parent" id="comment-8923">
<div id="div-comment-8923" class="comment-body">
<div class="comment-author vcard">
<img alt='' src='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/1a08fb271071050a4873c0ab5b27c7ba?s=100&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g' srcset='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/1a08fb271071050a4873c0ab5b27c7ba?s=200&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g 2x' class='avatar avatar-100 photo' height='100' width='100' /> <cite class="fn">Pankaj</cite> <span class="says">says:</span> </div>
<div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2013/07/advanced-analytics-certifications/#comment-8923">
May 23, 2014 at 7:14 pm</a> </div>
<p>You have not mentioned about PRAXIS BUSINESS SCHOOL, Kolkata which offers a full time one year Post Graduate Program in Business Analytics (PGPBA) .The knowledge partners are India&#8217;s largest private bank ICICI Bank &amp; world&#8217;s largest professinal services provider and largest of &#8220;Big Four&#8221; PwC (PricewaterhouseCoopers) .</p>
<p>Its is the best course in India at this point of time. There are many reasons for that. First of all the study of Business Analytics is so wide and large that it cannot be covered in just 6 months or 3 months of part time study. It covers Advanced Statistics, Machine Learning, Data Mining, Data Visualization,etc. Apart from this one needs to learn tools like SAS or R. Also one needs to have domain knowledge of fields like Finance, Retail, Telecom, etc. All this is being covered in one course by Praxis Analytics Course.</p>
<p>All this can&#8217;t be done in just 3 months or 6 months part time study. Only this course from PRAXIS <a href="http://praxis.ac.in/programs/b" rel="nofollow">http://praxis.ac.in/programs/b</a>&#8230; offers all in one package. It is being taught by eminent faculties fron IIT Kharagpur, IIT Kanpur, IIM Calcutta, etc. The course content is very rich in terms of Technical, Business &amp; Analytical learning.<br />
Last but not the least , placements are just excellent after completing the course. They have tie-ups with many niche companies like PwC,ICICI,Fidelity, Bridgei2i, etc. All the students have been placed so far by them.</p>
<div class="reply"><a rel='nofollow' class='comment-reply-link' href='#comment-8923' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "div-comment-8923", "8923", "respond", "293" )' aria-label='Reply to Pankaj'>Reply</a></div>

<ul class="children">
<li class="comment even depth-3 parent" id="comment-9302">
<div id="div-comment-9302" class="comment-body">
<div class="comment-author vcard">
<img alt='' src='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4ca9f6317bc2ccb64d84d9c1e5d62675?s=100&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g' srcset='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4ca9f6317bc2ccb64d84d9c1e5d62675?s=200&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g 2x' class='avatar avatar-100 photo' height='100' width='100' /> <cite class="fn">Vaidhy</cite> <span class="says">says:</span> </div>
<div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2013/07/advanced-analytics-certifications/#comment-9302">
May 28, 2014 at 12:11 pm</a> </div>
<p>Ok, here I go for the benefit of the bigger audience. </p>
<p>There are many pitfalls in this program being offered by NIIT. I have already notified the management of the same, but tangible improvement is yet to be seen. </p>
<p>First and foremost, the quality expected out of NIIT is a far cry &#8211; be it the faculty, courseware, content, content delivery, management, operations, technical infrastructure etc . When placement assurance is not an explicit expectation (or commitment), the scale automatically tilts to the quality of training and the level of knowledge gained.</p>
<p>I am not sure who is overseeing the entire batch and course per se, who is gauging the training effectiveness, taking feedback on the faculty and conduct of the course etc. I can see that conducting several batches in parallel is taking a toll on their resources and hence the drop in quality on several aspects. </p>
<p>The course modules are not happening in a proper sequence, there is no traceability between the presentation materials, courseware and any external references that we might do. The breaks are irregular, unplanned and long. More than 50% of the time spent gets wasted due to fluency (lack of) of communication, breaks, interruptions, searching for something etc.</p>
<p>With around 2 months gone by out of the 6 months course, I am not too sure where I am at and upto.</p>
<p>I hope these details are helpful to the intended audience. Just be aware of the facts, analyse the pros and cons before taking this course at NIIT and don&#8217;t fall for just the brand value, that may be ok for folks at the entry level.</p>
<p>Thanks<br />
Vaidhy</p>
<div class="reply"><a rel='nofollow' class='comment-reply-link' href='#comment-9302' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "div-comment-9302", "9302", "respond", "293" )' aria-label='Reply to Vaidhy'>Reply</a></div>
</div>

May 27, 2014 at 12:36 pm</a> </div>
<p>I have been working with an IT MNC company for 9+ years and i am playing Techno functional role.<br />
ISB CBA course will definitely take my profile to next level, and i am following Data Analytics topics for a year now. It interests me.</p>
<p>I have few questions in mind<br />
1. ISB asks for letter from an employer. Incase i had to move out of organization, will it any way effect the ongoing course with ISB?<br />
2. Can people who are not working currently(but worked earlier) enrol for this course?<br />
3. I am anticipating travel outside India in next 6 months, should i hold myself from enroling in this course.<br />
Does any Indian Universities support continuing the course outside India?<br />
4. Can any 1st or 2nd batch ISB CBA Alumni, share their experiences with this course.</p>
<p>I will definitely share my experiences as i go along this Data Analytics lane.<br />
Thanks to all wonderful people who shared their views so far.</p>
<p>&#8211;Krishna</p>

June 1, 2014 at 3:23 pm</a> </div>
<p>Krishna,</p>
<p>Nice to hear about your journey. Will definitely be interested in how it pans out.</p>
<p>1. It ideally should not, but the course is aimed towards working professionals. I am sure if you have a good reason for moving out, they should consider it.</p>
<p>2 &#038; 3 &#8211; It is best that you check out with ISB directly. I don&#8217;t think any one supports course outside India, except for the ones which are purely online in nature. Depending on why and for how long you are travelling, you can consider doing a course outside India as well.</p>
<p>Thanks,<br />
Kunal</p>

<p>I left the answer in the draft stage and thought it was posted!</p>
<p>Here is my take: You can check out the opening from Great Lakes Institute. It has good course with ample classroom interactions.</p>
<p>If this still pinches the pocket, you can check out the offering by Jigsaw Academy. Hope this helps.</p>

Kunal</p>

July 7, 2014 at 9:42 am</a> </div>
<p>Hi Kunal,</p>
<p>Thank you for your reply. There is a huge shortage of people like you who provide unbiased guidance to people like us. </p>
<p>I checked both the institutes and did some Google search on both. Great lakes is too expensive for me and on top of it their course structure is prepared by Jigsaw itself. So I think I should go with Jigsaw&#8217;s online course &#8211; foundation course in analytics (video based). </p>
<p>I have few more queries:</p>
<p>1) I do not have a programming back ground so is it necessary to learn R, hadoop etc or only learning SAS is enough. Because learning all at a time will be difficult I think.</p>
<p>2) Recently, I read another blog where a person took the basic course from Jigsaw and then took another comprehensive course from IIM Bangalore. So does that mean doing the basic course will not fetch me a job in analytics? Is the name of IIMs or any big institute so important in your resume?</p>
<p>3) After doing the course from Jigsaw, what should be my course of action to get a job in analytics? what are chances of getting a job in NCR.</p>
<p>I have left my job at EY, Gurgaon as a Lead Analyst recently. I was into a dead end secondary research job that I could not carry on with me any further. I know my decision is bold enough as I am married too. But I had no other option, I could not do any course side by side over weekend as I was not able to focus in studies.</p>
<p>I am sad that you have not started your own institute as of yet. please let me know if you are starting one.</p>

<div class="comment-author vcard">
<img alt='' src='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=100&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g' srcset='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=200&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g 2x' class='avatar avatar-100 photo' height='100' width='100' /> <cite class="fn"><a href='http://www.analyticsvidhya.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Kunal Jain</a></cite> <span class="says">says:</span> </div>
<div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2013/07/advanced-analytics-certifications/#comment-13611">
July 8, 2014 at 10:02 am</a> </div>
<p>Manish,</p>
<p>Here are answers to your queries:</p>
<p>1. Start with SAS and learn it completely before touching any other language. SAS has more than 60% market share in analytics today.</p>
<p>2. The course from Jigsaw would provide you all the material you need. But you, need to put in more efforts at your end. Given, you are out of job now, you can focus on learning new techniques. If I was in your position, I would take a course from Jigsaw, start learning additional skills on the side and try and demonstrate it by practical applications &#8211; e.g. application on a few simple Kaggle competitions.</p>
<p>If you show enough willingess and learning, you should get a job straight after your course. If not, then probably 3 -6 months, before you get a job.</p>
<p>I personally respect your decision a lot. I did something similar a few months back, when I decided to go full time in Analytics Vidhya. I have a 10 month old baby along with a wife (I was the only earning member) &#8211; but guess what, nothing beats the satisfaction you get, by doing the work you love.</p>
<p>Regards,<br />
Kunal</p>
<div class="reply"><a rel='nofollow' class='comment-reply-link' href='#comment-13611' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "div-comment-13611", "13611", "respond", "293" )' aria-label='Reply to Kunal Jain'>Reply</a></div>
</div>
</li>
<li class="comment even depth-5" id="comment-15838">
<div id="div-comment-15838" class="comment-body">
<div class="comment-author vcard">
<img alt='' src='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/0716a45c8edf2698fd45440bdd7ac360?s=100&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g' srcset='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/0716a45c8edf2698fd45440bdd7ac360?s=200&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g 2x' class='avatar avatar-100 photo' height='100' width='100' /> <cite class="fn">manish</cite> <span class="says">says:</span> </div>
<div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2013/07/advanced-analytics-certifications/#comment-15838">
August 5, 2014 at 11:17 am</a> </div>
<p>Hi Kunal,</p>
<p>I have few questions to be resolved before I decide to enroll for foundation of analytics course from Jigsaw academy which is asking for 26,000 rs. I have sent a similar query to Jigsaw today.</p>
<p>I checked the syllabus of this course; I can see core subjects as these:</p>
<p>a)	Predictive Modeling Techniques<br />
b)	Statistical Concepts and their Application in Business<br />
c)	Basic Analytic Techniques &#8211; Using Language of SAS</p>
<p>These are basic concepts which are available for free on platforms like<br />
Coursera &#8211; <a href="https://www.coursera.org/course/datascitoolbox" rel="nofollow">https://www.coursera.org/course/datascitoolbox</a><br />
Udacity &#8211; <a href="https://www.udacity.com/courses#!/data-science" rel="nofollow">https://www.udacity.com/courses#!/data-science</a><br />
SAS.com. </p>
<p>SAS has recently introduced a free university edition which I have installed which seems great for now. I explored more and found that SAS provided free e-learning modules like and they are really good in terms of explaining the basic concepts.</p>
<p>Currently, I am taking few courses from sas.com &#8211; <a href="https://support.sas.com/edu/schedules.html?ctry=US&#038;id=277" rel="nofollow">https://support.sas.com/edu/schedules.html?ctry=US&#038;id=277</a></p>
<p>There are so many other free e- learning tutorials from SAS available which you can practice on SAS studio university edition. Check out the link &#8211; <a href="http://support.sas.com/training/tutorial/" rel="nofollow">http://support.sas.com/training/tutorial/</a></p>
<p>Considering the free options which seem to be really good, my questions are:</p>
<p>1.	Are the study material and video lectures of Jigsaw better than the free resources above?<br />
2.	If the answer to the above question is simply Yes, then still it is hard for me to believe because I have seen the video lectures and e-learning videos and looks like they are created with very good research and using good technology (esp the SAS e-learning). To believe, I would like to see some videos that explain the concepts of statistics and SAS. The free resources on Jigsaw only have videos of general knowledge of analytics and the tools used. It does not provide a free video of the actual course content.<br />
3.	As far as the certification is concerned, the free resources also provide certification at a very nominal fee and that too with a stamp of good foreign universities.</p>
<p>I am just trying to be a devil’s advocate to get a clearer view. As you may agree that in India how various universities are running courses and taking huge money but they are so worthless. Same applies for the online study platforms.</p>
<p>Last year I enrolled for a course of certified research expert from IIPMR.com for rs. 30,000. I joined the course after reading the detailed fancy course syllabus and few good reviews of the course. After joining the course I felt so bad that because the promise that it made turned out to be all false. The video lectures were not very good and not worth 30,000 at all. I stop the course in between as it resulted in deviating my interest from market research courses and any other online course for that matter.</p>
<p>Please reply.</p>
<p>Regards,<br />
Manish</p>

<img alt='' src='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=100&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g' srcset='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=200&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g 2x' class='avatar avatar-100 photo' height='100' width='100' /> <cite class="fn"><a href='http://www.analyticsvidhya.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Kunal Jain</a></cite> <span class="says">says:</span> </div>

June 1, 2014 at 12:35 pm</a> </div>
<p>Shirsendu,</p>
<p>I would recommend that you read <a href="http://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2014/05/planning-late-career-shift-analytics-big-data-prepared/" title="Planning a late career shift to Analytics / Big data? Better be prepared!" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">this articl</a>e for understanding some background. You are actually in a lot better place than what the article describes, as you are shifting from a business role to Analytics role in same domain. Your experience will be of immense help.</p>
<p>I can only make definitive recommendations, once I understand more details about:</p>
<ol>
<li>How good are you with Maths, Probability and Stats?</li>
<li>How much coding experience do you have? Did you enjoy coding when you were in College?</li>
<li>Are you looking for a complete shift into Analytics role or are looking to use analytics to help you in your role?</li>
</ol>
<p>While the exact answer would depend on what you say, you can check out the HR Analytics course from Jigsaw Academy. This course is one of the most relevant courses as of now.</p>
<p>Thanks,<br />
Kunal</p>

June 7, 2014 at 5:56 pm</a> </div>
<p>Hi Kunal,</p>
<p>I have 4 years of Exp with a MBA degree. I have seriously thought of pursuing a career towards Business Analytics and after lot of research found that ISB offers the right curriculum but the big question &#8211;</p>
<p>As I have Marketing exp and no contacts towards software companies and also my company doesnt need business analyst how would I get placed after the course? Could you please throw some light towards how a candidate like me could be placed and the source of placement</p>

<p>Any insights would really help a lot</p>

<div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2013/07/advanced-analytics-certifications/#comment-10204">
June 9, 2014 at 9:04 pm</a> </div>
<p>Satya,</p>
<p>As I have heard, placements of ISB course have been good (80%+ placed). But these are not official numbers and should be taken with a pinch of salt.</p>
<p>If you are serious about taking up this course from ISB, I would urge you to take a few courses from Coursera, Udacity and eDX till the run up to the admissions. This will give you a flavour of the course and give you some headstart in to the course.</p>
<p>Regards,<br />
Kunal</p>

<p>Bhavik,</p>
<p>Both of them are very similar, I would rate IIMC slightly more than IIML. I feel ISB and Great Lakes are better than the both of these.</p>
<p>I think the placement across the courses would remain similar, what would change is the probability of getting placed. Given that your work ex is not in analytics, be prepared to be treated as a person with lower work ex. You can look at this article for more details:</p>
<p><a href="http://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2014/05/planning-late-career-shift-analytics-big-data-prepared/" rel="nofollow">http://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2014/05/planning-late-career-shift-analytics-big-data-prepared/</a></p>
<p>Thanks,<br />
Kunal</p>

June 14, 2014 at 8:01 am</a> </div>
<p>Hi Kunal,</p>
<p>I did MS (Pharma) specialized in Medicinal Chemistry from NIPER Hyd . Currently I am working as an Analyst at Global Data Buisiness and Market Research Company, Hyderabad. Do really Buisiness Analytics course help to grow my career ? how will be the 9 months certificate course offered by NMIMS for Buisiness Analytics helpful. Can you please help me in this path, where we are supposed to pay nearly 2 Lakhs for this course in a span of 9 months. I am a confused and really seek your guidance. If i complete this course where and what kind of oppurtunities may i get? The institute people from NMIMS informed that thyey are not going to asist in any placement. <div class="reply"><a rel='nofollow' class='comment-reply-link' href='#comment-10616' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "div-comment-10616", "10616", "respond", "293" )' aria-label='Reply to sirisha m'>Reply</a></div>

<ul class="children">
<li class="comment byuser comment-author-kunalj bypostauthor odd alt depth-2" id="comment-10727">
<div id="div-comment-10727" class="comment-body">
<div class="comment-author vcard">
<img alt='' src='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=100&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g' srcset='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=200&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g 2x' class='avatar avatar-100 photo' height='100' width='100' /> <cite class="fn"><a href='http://www.analyticsvidhya.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Kunal Jain</a></cite> <span class="says">says:</span> </div>
<div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2013/07/advanced-analytics-certifications/#comment-10727">
June 15, 2014 at 7:12 pm</a> </div>
<p>Sirisha,</p>
<p>A very relevant question. </p>
<p>These courses definitely help people who are new to the industry. For people who are already in the industry, a lot depends on the quality of their work experience. If you already have a role, which requires you to apply advanced business analytics, there is little benefit to doing these certifications. </p>
<p>However, if your role is more inclined towards MIS and reporting, then these courses are a boon. I would suggest that you take up a course which requires you to study part time, continue to work for your current employer and search for relevant openings during the course.</p>
<p>I don&#8217;t know details about NMIMS, as it is a relatively new course. If you are open to other institutes, you should check out programmes from institutes with more experience.</p>
<p>Regards,<br />
Kunal</p>
<div class="reply"><a rel='nofollow' class='comment-reply-link' href='#comment-10727' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "div-comment-10727", "10727", "respond", "293" )' aria-label='Reply to Kunal Jain'>Reply</a></div>
</div>
</li>
</ul>
</li>

<p>Hi Kunal,</p>
<p>Thanks for nurturing a very useful forum. I am into marketing research since past 6 years and predominantly in the FMCG industry. Totally agree that ISB offers one of the best Analytics cource in India. However, my worry is whether the course offered is technical in nature (more for data scientists) and hence what will be its relevance for my current role. </p>
<p>Please note that currently I work on Analytic projects like market mix modelling and pricing anlaytics but from business stand and not actually run this analysis on my own. Work with the agencies closely to get the right output to answer the business questions.</p>
<p>Need your views on whether this course will be relevant and helpful for my current role</p>
<p>Thanks<br />
Niyati</p>

<li class="comment byuser comment-author-kunalj bypostauthor odd alt depth-2 parent" id="comment-11773">
<div id="div-comment-11773" class="comment-body">
<div class="comment-author vcard">
<img alt='' src='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=100&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g' srcset='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=200&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g 2x' class='avatar avatar-100 photo' height='100' width='100' /> <cite class="fn"><a href='http://www.analyticsvidhya.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Kunal Jain</a></cite> <span class="says">says:</span> </div>
<div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2013/07/advanced-analytics-certifications/#comment-11773">
June 23, 2014 at 10:32 pm</a> </div>
<p>Niyati,</p>
<p>Very relevant question. The course is designed for people who want to get into hands on analytics role. Unfortunately, there aren&#8217;t too many courses available right now, which provide you the kind of exposure you are looking at.</p>
<p>ISB started one course recently, which is a short duration course and is aimed towards senior management. If costs 7L + taxes. Otherwise, you can learn about analytics through a few high level courses available on Coursera as part of data science specialization.</p>
<p>Hope this helps.<br />
Kunal</p>

<div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2013/07/advanced-analytics-certifications/#comment-11827">
June 24, 2014 at 6:34 am</a> </div>
<p>Hi kunal,</p>
<p>First of all I would like to appreciate the efforts put in by you for wonderful blog.I have a experience of 4.5 years in SAP business intelligence(implementations, rollout, support) and I am looking for the course offered by ISB in business analytics. My major concern is that since ISB does not provide placement assistance as of now what will be the growth I will get from this course.DO you have any info on someone who has completed this course?</p>

<li class="comment even depth-2 parent" id="comment-13174">
<div id="div-comment-13174" class="comment-body">
<div class="comment-author vcard">
<img alt='' src='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/05301085fb9f38b3a0b26085db27f63f?s=100&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g' srcset='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/05301085fb9f38b3a0b26085db27f63f?s=200&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g 2x' class='avatar avatar-100 photo' height='100' width='100' /> <cite class="fn">vishwash</cite> <span class="says">says:</span> </div>
<div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2013/07/advanced-analytics-certifications/#comment-13174">
July 3, 2014 at 11:23 pm</a> </div>
<p>To be frank, I have done this programme and found very useful. If you are thinking you will get a job as soon as you finish this programme then it would be difficult. I am saying its difficult in a context that you will learn every module as mentioned in the programme structure and the eminent faculties will give you a clear concepts in each module, but the thing is you need to explore more into those module and acquire in depth knowledge with the help of concepts, case studies, tools and techniques which you will be learning there, as you can see just in three months they can&#8217;t cover all the topics in depth. In broad sense it requires your efforts post course completion.</p>
<p>At last I would like to say with the help of &#8220;EPBABI + Your efforts post completion of the programme&#8221; you will be able to crack analytics interviews easily.</p>
<p>You need to contact Prof. Pradip Kumar Bala to know when they will start next batch in Hyderabad.</p>
<p>If you need more information regarding EPBABI, please let me know.</p>
<p>Regards,<br />
Vishwash</p>

<li class="comment even depth-4 parent" id="comment-13359">
<div id="div-comment-13359" class="comment-body">
<div class="comment-author vcard">
<img alt='' src='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/05301085fb9f38b3a0b26085db27f63f?s=100&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g' srcset='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/05301085fb9f38b3a0b26085db27f63f?s=200&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g 2x' class='avatar avatar-100 photo' height='100' width='100' /> <cite class="fn">vishwash</cite> <span class="says">says:</span> </div>
<div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2013/07/advanced-analytics-certifications/#comment-13359">
July 5, 2014 at 2:58 pm</a> </div>
<p>Hi Amit,</p>
<p>I am labeling your each question and providing the best possible answer that I can give : </p>
<p>1. I have completed this programme in mid Feb 2014.<br />
2. Yes I am getting lots of interview call, as always analyticsvidhya.com job section is really helpful in finding jobs into analytics.<br />
3. I am fresh grad and did this course because my stats and maths was strong and wanted to move into analytics.<br />
4. I was the only fresh grad and remaining were having work-ex ranging from 2 years -12 years. Now I have to ask them on our EPBABI group on Linkedin, if someone has successfully shifted his/her career after completing EPBABI Programme. I will intimate you once I get reply from them.<br />
5. For more insight of the course call me 8884766652.<br />
6.Yes, without maths, stats and probability you can not learn analytics. So I would recommend you get some time now itself to learn maths and stats before doing any analytics course and when you feel comfortable with these concepts you can enroll for EPBABI.<br />
7.Faculties are just awesome. I would give 9.5 out of 10. They are very helpful and will provide you every data sets, books, and materials a week ago and will help you even after finishing the course.<br />
8. Sorry, I don&#8217;t have experience how is that comfortable doing the course in parallel with job.<br />
9. If you have asked me this question &#8221; How interesting to work as a Data Analyst&#8221; then based on my learning and understanding and in layman terms &#8211; Its like you are doctor of data where you will be dealing with lots of data but initially your data are speech-impaired and you have to give a right treatment then your data start speaking the truth. 😉 So you can understand how interesting the analytics field is&#8230;</p>
<p>Also you might have heard the Harvard Business Reviews, &#8220;Data Scientist &#8211; The Sexiest Job of 21st Century&#8221;</p>
<p>Hope I have clarified your queries.</p>
<p>Regards,<br />
Vishwash</p>

<li class="comment odd alt depth-3" id="comment-13648">

<p>Hi Kunal, </p>
<p>My name is Surya.I am 25 yrs old and a b.tech graduate( civil ).I currently don&#8217;t have a job.However I had 2.5 yrs of work Experience for a Back end Support Operations at amazon.com.</p>
<p>I left my job for pursuing M.B.A , However I couldn,t get into Good B school.Now i have an admission offer for ISB-CBA Program(Differed my admission during January Intake),But I came across another institute called INSOFE which also imparts Analytics. (<a href="http://www.insofe.edu.in/" rel="nofollow">http://www.insofe.edu.in/</a>)</p>
<p>My graduation and Experience doesn&#8217;t relate to analytics.</p>
<p>Please find Various parameters of both Programs below.</p>
<p>Parameters: ISB-CBA INSOFE</p>
<p>Brand Value: Yes No</p>
<p>Cost: Rs 714160 /- Rs 252810/-</p>
<p> (Including tax and SAS chrages) Including tax</p>
<p>Duration: 1 year 6 Months</p>
<p>Career Service: No Yes</p>
<p>SAS: Yes No</p>
<p>R Language: No Yes</p>
<p>Hadoop: No Yes</p>
<p>Type of Program: Certificate Program Certificate Program</p>
<p>Mode of Learning: 5 day classes(alternate month) Weekend classes</p>
<p>Is it right choice for me to do Analytics course at this moment as both my graduation and experience doesn&#8217;t co-relate with Analytics.</p>
<p>Secondly , What is your suggestion on which program I need to choose among both ISB and INSOFE and why ?</p>
<p>I humbly request you to reply for this message.</p>
<p>Regards,<br />
Surya</p>

<div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2013/07/advanced-analytics-certifications/#comment-15186">
July 28, 2014 at 6:38 am</a> </div>
<p>Deepika,</p>
<p>Here are a few things you can try to get hands on experience:</p>
<p>1. Check out a few competitions on Kaggle. Try and participate on a few ones to get a decent rank. Then use it on your CV.</p>
<p>2. Similarly look for freelancing jobs on elance adn use it for experience.</p>
<p>3. You can also look, if there are any internships, which are available.</p>
<p>Regards,<br />
Kunal</p>

<p>I am 34 years old , PGDBA (marketing) and having 10+ years of work exp. in sales of financial product , mainly equipment loan. Presently working as state head for a leading NBFC , </p>
<p>Am looking forward to change my domain from sales to analytics ,and focusing on course offered by ISB . or IIT Delhi. I don&#8217;t have prior knowledge or any experience with analytics.</p>
<p>Wanted your opinion on :</p>
<p>1) Does any of these two institutes offer placement help .<br />
2) With my background of 10+years in sales in financial sector , will I be able to get a job in analytics domain.<br />

July 28, 2014 at 6:34 am</a> </div>
<p>Rajat,</p>
<p>1. None of these insitutes offer placement help.</p>
<p>2. You should be able to. You can read this article for some more things, you should do to ensure a better shift.</p>
<p>3. Salaries for freshers vary from 5L &#8211; 12L in analytics. You get into the bracket you mentioned with 4 &#8211; 5 years of good experience in predictive anlaytics. Given you are not a complete freshere, you can probably expect similar salary in a couple of years.</p>
<p>Regards,<br />
Kunal</p>

<p>Arpit,</p>
<p>I think you can earn money in either profile (BI or BA). I advice people to chosse stream based on passion and not on how much money then think, they can make.</p>
<p>So, you need to first decide whether it is BI or BA. Once you have done so, you can add knowledge appropriately. Indian programs will not be recognized in the US.</p>
<p>Regards,<br />
Kunal</p>

<li class="comment odd alt thread-even depth-1 parent" id="comment-14735">
<div id="div-comment-14735" class="comment-body">
<div class="comment-author vcard">
<img alt='' src='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/6d4c8f9ba082b04bee9c3ff490f3ae11?s=100&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g' srcset='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/6d4c8f9ba082b04bee9c3ff490f3ae11?s=200&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g 2x' class='avatar avatar-100 photo' height='100' width='100' /> <cite class="fn">Jay</cite> <span class="says">says:</span> </div>

<p>Hi Kunal,<br />
This is my first conversation with you, I’ve literally swept across your discussions forum on Analytics Vidhya. It’s a really good thing you’re doing guiding people in this new field.<br />
No doubt i had quite a lot of questions answered there itself, unfortunately i have a few more. If you could give a little time here it’d be much appreciated.</p>
<p>I’m an B.E (Comp science) from Bangalore, 2009. After that i didn’t pick up an IT job, tried couple of things here and there(nothing concrete). After that i prepared for MBA entrance and scored a 92 percentile in CAT. i did get admissions in a few good colleges but because of family issues i had to head back home.<br />
From there onwards I started a business in automobiles and have been running that from the past 3 years. I now wish to get back into the corporate world, i’ve done a decent amount of search in Data Analytics and yes it does excite me.</p>
<p>I wish to do an Online course, I’ve seen you really rate ISB but i’m kinda late for that. IIT Bombay now has regular classes for 4 months(rather than a 1 year online course)<br />
IIT Delhi- Ivory education. This one seems feasible for me, in monetary terms and geographically as well.</p>
<p>So here are my enquiries.<br />
1. Does my business/entrepreneur experience count or benefit in this line of work ?<br />
2. Is there a difference between Data Analyst and Business Analyst? Cause I’m not very interested in the coding dept. would want to work towards the business/managment end.<br />
3. I contacted Ivory education, they said they haven’t decided “Which IIT” will be conducting this program? (should i be worried? cuz it’s the IIT’s prestige and name which i think makes this one tick.<br />
4. There are massive chances i move to the states in the coming years, say about 2 years. I’m doing this so i could benefit from this course and increase my chances of getting a job there.<br />
5. This place (Ivory education) has 2 courses 1)Business Analytics and Optimization<br />
2) Advanced Business Analytics and Optimization program.<br />
Which course should i be going for? I spoke to the person from there and the lady said that a direct jump to the “Advanced” course isn’t impossible but jus requires you to work a little harder. I’m okay with that but me looking at the Course structure would not be able to choose wisely. Could u help with that.<br />
6. Apart from the Centres mentioned and IIM calcutta, if there is any other you suggest i’d surely look into it.(Online Course)</p>
<p>It’d be really nice if you could respond to this soon as time is running out for the applications.</p>
<p>Regards,</p>
<p>Gagan</p>

<li class="comment byuser comment-author-kunalj bypostauthor even depth-2" id="comment-14927">
<div id="div-comment-14927" class="comment-body">
<div class="comment-author vcard">
<img alt='' src='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=100&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g' srcset='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=200&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g 2x' class='avatar avatar-100 photo' height='100' width='100' /> <cite class="fn"><a href='http://www.analyticsvidhya.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Kunal Jain</a></cite> <span class="says">says:</span> </div>
<div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2013/07/advanced-analytics-certifications/#comment-14927">
July 25, 2014 at 6:25 am</a> </div>
<p>Dear Jay / Gagan,</p>
<p>Interesting, I had got a very similar query a few days back form a person who had very similar questions and situation! Anyways here are the answers:</p>
<p>1. Not much. Will help you understand the business perspective quickly though.<br />
2. Yes, data analyst is typically referred to as person involved in collating and cleaning data. Making sure that data is available for analytics. Business analyst typically interacts with business and performs the analysis. These description hold true in general and not always. You would require coding in both the scenarios for a long term career.<br />
3. I would be worried, if I was in your place.<br />
5. You can go for advanced.<br />
6. You can try certification programmes from the likes of Jigsaw, Edureka etc.</p>
<p>Regards</p>
<div class="reply"><a rel='nofollow' class='comment-reply-link' href='#comment-14927' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "div-comment-14927", "14927", "respond", "293" )' aria-label='Reply to Kunal Jain'>Reply</a></div>

<p>In my case they did not ask any technical question.</p>

<p>Analytics can definitely be helpful in your career. The question is how much time and resources can you invest to get into analytics.</p>
<p>You can check out Jigsaw, who are based in Bangalore, but deliver online trainings.</p>
<p>Regards,<br />
Kunal</p>

<p>The recommendation would depend on your experience and motivation. If you are a starter &#8211; then SAS.</p>
<p>If you are already familiar with basics of analytics &#8211; may be Hadoop with R.</p>

Kunal</p>

<p>I did a bit of research for SAS. Jigsaw provides a decent course for it. </p>
<p>What do u think of Coursera? They are providing online courses and even providing certifications if you complete the course. I checked it out for R Programming. <a href="https://www.coursera.org/course/rprog" rel="nofollow">https://www.coursera.org/course/rprog</a><br />
(They are affiliated with Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Pubic health.) Now here&#8217;s the catch! they arent charging for it, its for free!!)<br />
What are your views on this?</p>
<p>Regards.</p>

<div class="comment-author vcard">
<img alt='' src='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/6d4c8f9ba082b04bee9c3ff490f3ae11?s=100&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g' srcset='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/6d4c8f9ba082b04bee9c3ff490f3ae11?s=200&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g 2x' class='avatar avatar-100 photo' height='100' width='100' /> <cite class="fn">Jay</cite> <span class="says">says:</span> </div>

August 1, 2014 at 8:04 am</a> </div>
<p>I made a mistake there. The course is for free, the certification however is for 29$/course.</p>
<p>The Entire Specialisation of &#8220;Data Science&#8221; is for 310$ (9 courses) with some accessibility privileges.</p>
<p><a href="https://www.coursera.org/specialization/jhudatascience/1?utm_medium=courseDescripTop" rel="nofollow">https://www.coursera.org/specialization/jhudatascience/1?utm_medium=courseDescripTop</a></p>
<p>Please have a quick look if you can. The Course content is also mentioned.</p>
<p>What are your views on this?<br />
I&#8217;m guessing it holds more value in the states than it does in India.<br />
Seems decent.</p>
<p>Regards.</p>

<p>During interview they like to know, why do you want to do this course, How this course will add on to profile, why ISB, Where would you like to see yourself after 5 years in this field. such questions they will ask.</p>
<p>hope this will help&#8230;</p>

<p>I hope you will advise me and break the confusions I have been had.</p>
<p>Education:<br />
1. BSc in computers, statistics and maths<br />
2. MBA in Marketing</p>
<p>Experience: 6+ years experience in data modelling in the market research space but no exposure to any analytical tools. All I do is collection of various statistics from diff sources and prepare a meaningful picture, which is most likely topline information &#8211; trade economics, business volumes, pricing estimations etc. Also experienced in trend analysis, forecasting/estimates etc..</p>
<p>I have recently learned SAS BASE from an unauthorized institute.</p>
<p>Questions:<br />
1. How does an executive program, probably from IIMs, apply to my career. Do I have any alternatives in economy.<br />
1.1 Which is the best institute. I&#8217;m not interested in ISB as I want continue to work<br />
1.2 Does IIM CULCUTTA cover SAS module in their curriculum, which is a basic foundation for analytics<br />
1.3 IIM Ranchi &#8211; do you have any updates so far to your beginning posts and questions of our folks.<br />
1.4 As I&#8217;m based out of Chennai, do you suggest me any premium institutes having contact hours in the weekend.</p>
<p>2. I&#8217;m hearing a lot about BIG DATA, what is this all about.<br />
2.1 do you have any idea how good is this going to penetrate the market.<br />
2.2 what sector companies foreseeing to this space. I heard mostly retail.<br />
2.3 what is the average size of employment, jus considering shortage of talent pool from domestic and international companies like eg flipkart or ebay or Pepsi etc etc</p>
<p>3. Finallyl it matters for everyone (compensation). Do you have any pay scale survey report &#8211; including freshers with none domain experience. </p>
<p>Sorry to bother you with many questions. I still have more</p>

<li class="comment byuser comment-author-kunalj bypostauthor odd alt depth-2 parent" id="comment-20765">
<div id="div-comment-20765" class="comment-body">
<div class="comment-author vcard">
<img alt='' src='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=100&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g' srcset='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=200&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g 2x' class='avatar avatar-100 photo' height='100' width='100' /> <cite class="fn"><a href='http://www.analyticsvidhya.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Kunal Jain</a></cite> <span class="says">says:</span> </div>
<div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2013/07/advanced-analytics-certifications/#comment-20765">
September 3, 2014 at 8:08 pm</a> </div>
<p>Srinivas,</p>
<p>Sorry for the late reply. I was not able to answer the queries for last few days. Here are your answers:</p>
<p>1. A lot depends on what you want to do after gaining knowledge in analytics. If you see this as skill enhancement for your next role in existing Organization, then IIMs are a good bet. If you are looking to transition into analytics completely, you will need to work and learn outside the curriculam offered from IIMs. </p>
<p>1.1 You can take classes from ISB while you are working. It is a part time course.</p>
<p>1.2 IIMC does not provide training on SAS currently. SAS is just a tool for applying analytics. There are others like R and Matlab, which are also popular.</p>
<p>1.3 No updates from IIM Ranchi &#8211; we can assume that there is no surety around next batch for now.</p>
<p>1.4 IIM Bangalore might be the nearest option.</p>
<p>2. You can read this <a href="http://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2013/07/big-data/" title="What is big data and how is big data architecture designed?" rel="nofollow">article</a> on Big data<br />
2.1 If you can believe forecasts, it would become a need for most of the MNCs<br />
2.2 The penetration would be led by Banks, Telecom, Retail and eCommerce because of the data they possess<br />
2.3 Not sure what you mean by size of employment, can you be a bit more specific?</p>
<p>3 Salaries for freshers vary from 5L on the lower side to 12L p.a. on the upper side depending on the role, company and the individual.</p>
<p>Once again, regret the delay in reply. I promise to make every possible effort to avoid these delays in future.</p>
<p>Regards,<br />
Kunal</p>

<div class="comment-author vcard">
<img alt='' src='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=100&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g' srcset='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=200&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g 2x' class='avatar avatar-100 photo' height='100' width='100' /> <cite class="fn"><a href='http://www.analyticsvidhya.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Kunal Jain</a></cite> <span class="says">says:</span> </div>
<div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2013/07/advanced-analytics-certifications/#comment-20769">
September 3, 2014 at 8:21 pm</a> </div>
<p>Akshay,</p>
<p>These certification courses have been more effective for people like you &#8211; who already have experience in BI. Apart form these options, you can do Online certifications from websites like Coursera / Udacity / eDX or from the likes of Jigsaw Academy.</p>
<p>SAS certification will definitely help &#8211; they have also released a few courses Online, which can be done at your own pace. You can look at that as well.</p>
<p>I am not updated on the latest status about the course from IIT Bombay &#8211; I think you should prefer a course which provides more experience in classrooms &#8211; may be ISB / Great Lakes.</p>
<p>Hope this helps.</p>
<p>REgards,<br />
Kunal</p>

<li class="comment byuser comment-author-kunalj bypostauthor even depth-2" id="comment-20772">
<div id="div-comment-20772" class="comment-body">
<div class="comment-author vcard">
<img alt='' src='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=100&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g' srcset='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=200&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g 2x' class='avatar avatar-100 photo' height='100' width='100' /> <cite class="fn"><a href='http://www.analyticsvidhya.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Kunal Jain</a></cite> <span class="says">says:</span> </div>
<div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2013/07/advanced-analytics-certifications/#comment-20772">
September 3, 2014 at 8:31 pm</a> </div>
<p>Vivek,</p>
<p>A couple of things you should keep in mind:</p>
<p>1. It is difficult to enable career change through a part time short duration course until you put in extra efforts to learn the subject at your end.</p>
<p>2. If you are making a switch &#8211; be prepared to compromise on your past work experience. You will not be considered at par with some one with similar number of years in work ex in stats / analytics.</p>
<p>So, if you are ready to put in extra efforts during the course, then these courses might help. A better strategy could be to take up roles which use similar skills but are in analytics doamin &#8211; e.g. project manager for analytics.</p>
<p>Hope this helps.</p>
<p>Regards,<br />
Kunal</p>

<div class="comment-author vcard">
<img alt='' src='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=100&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g' srcset='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=200&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g 2x' class='avatar avatar-100 photo' height='100' width='100' /> <cite class="fn"><a href='http://www.analyticsvidhya.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Kunal Jain</a></cite> <span class="says">says:</span> </div>
<div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2013/07/advanced-analytics-certifications/#comment-20758">
September 3, 2014 at 7:43 pm</a> </div>
<p>Vikram / Sandeep,</p>
<p>Switching career from non-analytics background might mean that you will need to give up the benefit of work experience. As long as you are comfortable with loss of the work-ex, you can start the process to make a switch. Please avoid NIIT completely. Edupristine would also not be able to provide enough exposure to provide you a shift into this role.</p>
<p>Great Lakes is a better, but a more expensive option. If you want me to connect you to them, drop me a mail and I&#8217;ll happy to do so.</p>
<p>Regards,<br />
Kunal</p>

August 3, 2014 at 3:55 pm</a> </div>
<p>Hello Kunal,</p>
<p>I was total unclear before going through all the comments and suggestions over here, thanks a lot. However, I still have a few, and would really need your help on the following.</p>
<p>let me take you into my details &#8211; I am mastered in MBA Marketing and have over 5 years exp. I am associated in investment banking process for one of big ticket clients. Responsibilities include market research and analysis.</p>
<p>I am considering IIM C for one year executive program. Please advice is this correct path to get into analytics. I heard any analytical tools (SAS, R, SPSS, Hadoop etcc) are not part of IIM C curriculum. </p>
<p>or Is Jigsaw better than IIM C as they do train up on these tools, i am not sure about therotical and industry cases through.</p>
<p>Thanks for your help</p>

<li class="comment byuser comment-author-kunalj bypostauthor odd alt depth-2" id="comment-20757">
<div id="div-comment-20757" class="comment-body">
<div class="comment-author vcard">
<img alt='' src='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=100&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g' srcset='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=200&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g 2x' class='avatar avatar-100 photo' height='100' width='100' /> <cite class="fn"><a href='http://www.analyticsvidhya.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Kunal Jain</a></cite> <span class="says">says:</span> </div>
<div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2013/07/advanced-analytics-certifications/#comment-20757">
September 3, 2014 at 7:40 pm</a> </div>
<p>Karna,</p>
<p>The choice for the right institute depends on what you want to do next. If you want to continue in investment profession, the course from IIM C can be good enough &#8211; you can always pick up the tools along the side as it is a 14 month programme.</p>
<p>If you want to transition into a predictive modeler king o role, then Jigsaw is much better compared to IIM C offering. Hope that gives you some clarity?</p>
<p>Regards,<br />
Kunal</p>

<div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2013/07/advanced-analytics-certifications/#comment-16843">
August 15, 2014 at 9:47 pm</a> </div>
<p>Dhiraj,</p>
<p>The course definitely adds value &#8211; but it depends exactly on what you want to achieve and what kind of role do you enjoy. If you want to become a hands on data scientist &#8211; this course will not help as much. However, if you want to become a consultant, client manager &#8211; these kind of courses can help. In this case, you can also look at course offered from Great Lakes.</p>
<p>Regards,<br />
Kunal</p>

<p>Hi Kunal,</p>
<p>After going through numerous reviews, regarding the growing trends of Business Analytics within different verticals of any corporate house, and the outline of the curriculum for BA, I&#8217;ve become interested in pursing some course for BA training. Currently, I&#8217;m working in quality engineering and assurance (QE&amp;A) area in the retail domain as a manual software tester in a US-based IT company in Kolkata. Being bored down by the mechanical nature of web-application testing, I want to shift my career from a vanilla-tester to a business analyst role. I&#8217;m interested to join the EPBA course provided by IIM-C delivered on Hughes Global Education interactive learning platform.<br />
In 2008, I passed the ISC exam with a 94.75% and in 2012, I had completed my B.Tech in Electronics &amp; Comm. Engg. from St.Thomas&#8217; college of Engg. &amp; Tech. in Kolkata with a DGPA of 9.23. So after 2 years of work experience, now I&#8217;m eagerly trying to find a career which has some creative, analytical and innovative instinct in it, and I&#8217;m finding the Business Analytics course, suits to my tastes.<br />
Could you please provide me some advice regarding my current choice on BA course, or if any other better options, and taking it as a career in the near future.</p>
<p>Thanks and Regards,<br />
Arpan</p>

August 23, 2014 at 5:29 pm</a> </div>
<p>Hi Kunal,</p>
<p>Hope you are doing great.<br />
Thanks a lot for sharing your knowledge and providing this excellent discussion platform.</p>
<p>I have 5.5 Yrs of experience in application development and currently working with Tier I company in Kolkata.<br />
I always had a knack for database and mathematics, which drew my focus in the field of analytic.<br />
I have already installed R and started exploring it while brushing the fundamentals of statistics.</p>
<p> I often come across few internal job postings for Business Analytic in my organization which I want to opt for in the coming months and for the same I want to take 6 months to 1 year time gaining knowledge and getting certified in Business Analytic.</p>
<p>Last week I got a call from Huges (for IIMC EPBA) and I also came to know that Praxis is going to start next week end online batch.</p>
<p>Could you please render some input/advice so that I can decide the next step (whether to opt for IIMC or Praxis or wait for the next openings) based on the below details.</p>
<p>a) Should I spend some more time on self learning since there are excellent materials available and I am able to learn as well?</p>
<p>b) IIMC EPBA is 14 months Course and it will give me ample time to learn. Also I can continue self learning (R programming etc.).</p>
<p>Doubt : This course seems to more on the theories. Will it worth attending the course for 14 months and no tools except Excel will be used. </p>
<p>c) Praxis offering 4 months course now and using many tools which is always handy while getting the real work. Also I will get a good overview and guideline very quickly using which I can upgrade myself at the same time I can start attending internal and external interviews.</p>
<p>Doubt: In 4 months (16 weeks) course with use of many tools, how conceptual it will be?</p>
<p>d) I am not in a hurry, but very keen to have a technical career in business analytic.</p>
<p>Please share your view and also comments from others folks (specially experienced BA) are as welcome.</p>
<p>Thanks in advance.</p>
<p>Regards,<br />
Joy</p>

<p>Hi Srini,</p>
<p>That is great. 🙂</p>
<p>As per the information provided by Praxis the course would be 4 months (16 weeks) for new batches contrary to the earlier program which was of 6 months (21 + weeks).<br />
They will update the details of course outline and schedule in a week. And it might be similar to the previous course with some small changes (<a href="http://praxis.ac.in/programs/weekend-business-analytics/" rel="nofollow">http://praxis.ac.in/programs/weekend-business-analytics/</a> ).</p>
<p>Could you also please share your thoughts on skewing towards IIMC course, specially on the technicality of the it?</p>
<p>Regards,<br />
Jyotirmoy</p>

<li class="comment byuser comment-author-kunalj bypostauthor even depth-5" id="comment-20744">
<div id="div-comment-20744" class="comment-body">
<div class="comment-author vcard">
<img alt='' src='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=100&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g' srcset='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=200&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g 2x' class='avatar avatar-100 photo' height='100' width='100' /> <cite class="fn"><a href='http://www.analyticsvidhya.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Kunal Jain</a></cite> <span class="says">says:</span> </div>
<div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2013/07/advanced-analytics-certifications/#comment-20744">
September 3, 2014 at 7:22 pm</a> </div>
<p>Srini / Joy,</p>
<p>Thanks for helping each other out. Here is my take for the questions Joy had asked originally:</p>
<p>Given that you are working with Tier I MNC &#8211; you should aim for getting the certification from ISB. That is the best among the lot. Also, if you are some one who is motivated enough &#8211; you can do most of the learning online and gain a bit of experience as well.</p>
<p>So, best option is to start learning from Coursera / eDX and then apply for ISB when they offer next batch. If ISB feels expensive and a bit ahead &#8211; go for IIMC course &#8211; but be prepared to put in efforts to learn technical details yourself.</p>
<p>Praxis also has decent reviews, but IIM brand trumps the backing on corporates like ICICI for some one like you.</p>
<p>Hope this is helpful.</p>
<p>Regards,<br />
Kunal</p>

<p>Pardeep,</p>
<p>There is no placement support ISB provides. If you are already in the industry, and have worked on SAS already &#8211; why not try the courses available on Coursera / Udacity / eDX. You would get some really good courses there.</p>
<p>Regards,<br />
Kunal</p>

<li class="comment even thread-odd thread-alt depth-1" id="comment-19022">
<div id="div-comment-19022" class="comment-body">
<div class="comment-author vcard">
<img alt='' src='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/5f3efa3ad125d5bbd7226eb20d75fe41?s=100&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g' srcset='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/5f3efa3ad125d5bbd7226eb20d75fe41?s=200&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g 2x' class='avatar avatar-100 photo' height='100' width='100' /> <cite class="fn">Chitrakant</cite> <span class="says">says:</span> </div>

August 27, 2014 at 9:01 am</a> </div>
<p>Hello Sir!</p>
<p>I am BTech in ECE and working in Digital marketing since 2012 May. I am also perusing my MBA in HR and Marketing. Now as I deal in Google Analytics and higher positions is Digital Marketing needs knowledge of big data and Data Science I am willing to do some Certificate/Degree in the same. I am also willing to build my career in the same field i.e. in Data Science. I am confused among MS in data science and certificates. MS will involve big investment where certification may or may not give me that much exposure. I have 44% in my 10th standard which pull me back always. That’s why I am little bit worried as well. Further I am not associated with any MNC although I have work experience in IT companies based in UK/Ireland. Can you please suggest me following?</p>
<p>1. Is it good to go with Certificate (Jigsaw/Green Lakes/Praxis)/MS (Germany)/M.Tech(Amity). I am not eligible for ISB and in IITs/IIMs I am not interested as most of them are currently offering short term programs less than a year.</p>
<p>2. Placement chances will be higher with which option? Will Jigsaw/Green Lakes/Praxis help in getting better jobs without placement assistance?</p>
<p>3. Indian companies prefer degrees or certificates? Especially MNCs</p>
<p>4. I am not form a premium business school/engineering college and also not working with a big brand. So which option is good for me Degree or certificate and from where?</p>
<p>Please reply!</p>

<p>Hi Kunal,</p>
<p>Thanks for the brilliant effort in proving useful inputs regarding the analytic course in this forum.<br />
I have around 13years of IT experience, out of which 10years in SAS ETL and SAS BI.I have not done work in analytics side, but used sas more for data management related to Data Warehouse/reporting(just simple business rules etc with out much analytics calculation).<br />
I have two kids, whom I need to spend sometime on the evening and weekends.</p>
<p>I am considering to take up IIMC EPBA 1yr program(by Hughes) for the following reasons, even though the cost is bit high<br />
and not dealing much technically into analytics tools.<br />
1.IIM brand value<br />
2.Gives me chance to get into and explore business analytics and adds value to my experience<br />
3.This analytics appln knowledge an certificate may fetch me managerial promotion in current organization.<br />
4.course center is very near to my house</p>
<p>Please suggest me, if I am taking good decision or any other option will be better than this.<br />
I explored following as well.<br />
ISB &#8211; it is very costly beyond my budget and travel to Hyderabad<br />
Jigsaw &#8211; very short term course covering technically.Also they are providing only online classes(which is difficult for me to take from home when kids are around).Also I have lots of online material and access to sas.<br />
IIT B 1yr program(by Hughes) &#8211; more technical, but for some reason has been stopped for past 2yrs</p>
<p>Kindly seeking your inputs as it will be of great help to me!</p>
<p>Thanks<br />
Mahesh</p>

<li class="comment byuser comment-author-kunalj bypostauthor even depth-2 parent" id="comment-20742">
<div id="div-comment-20742" class="comment-body">
<div class="comment-author vcard">
<img alt='' src='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=100&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g' srcset='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=200&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g 2x' class='avatar avatar-100 photo' height='100' width='100' /> <cite class="fn"><a href='http://www.analyticsvidhya.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Kunal Jain</a></cite> <span class="says">says:</span> </div>
<div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2013/07/advanced-analytics-certifications/#comment-20742">
September 3, 2014 at 7:14 pm</a> </div>
<p>Mahesh,</p>
<p>Given your constraints and criteria, I would say that IIM and Great Lakes are the possible choices. Given some of the reasons you mentioned, IIMC is a good choice. </p>
<p>However, you should keep following things in mind &#8211; don&#8217;t expect placement support from the course. If you are some one who doesn&#8217;t get comfortable until you get into details or have some hands on experience &#8211; the course might feel a bit superficial. However, it should impart you most of what an analytics manager needs to know.</p>
<p>Also, the course doesn&#8217;t cover any thing on Big data &#8211; until and unless they have changed the syllabus recently. I would take up a few online courses (even if it required you to sit in a coffee shop and watch them) to gear up on Big data along with the course.</p>
<p>Hope this helps.</p>
<p>Regards,<br />
Kunal</p>

<p>Hi Suraj,</p>
<p>Making a career shift after such a long experience can be a difficult experience. You can read this article for more details: “<a href="http://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2014/05/planning-late-career-shift-analytics-big-data-prepared/" title="Planning a late career shift to Analytics / Big data? Better be prepared!" rel="nofollow">Planning a late career shift to Analytics/ Big data? Better be prepared</a>”. You will need to start as a fresher and might find it hard getting a job in industry. Hence, I do not recommend making a shift after such long experience. If you are still convinced that you want to make a shift, you can go ahead and do it simultaneously. But, I normally do not recommend career shift with so much experience.</p>
<p>Regards,<br />
Kunal</p>
<div class="reply"><a rel='nofollow' class='comment-reply-link' href='#comment-80250' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "div-comment-80250", "80250", "respond", "293" )' aria-label='Reply to Kunal Jain'>Reply</a></div>
</div>
</li>
</ul>
</li>

<li class="comment byuser comment-author-kunalj bypostauthor even depth-2 parent" id="comment-24148">
<div id="div-comment-24148" class="comment-body">
<div class="comment-author vcard">
<img alt='' src='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=100&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g' srcset='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=200&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g 2x' class='avatar avatar-100 photo' height='100' width='100' /> <cite class="fn"><a href='http://www.analyticsvidhya.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Kunal Jain</a></cite> <span class="says">says:</span> </div>
<div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2013/07/advanced-analytics-certifications/#comment-24148">
September 21, 2014 at 5:56 am</a> </div>
<p>Roshan,</p>
<p>You can look at the courses available on Coursera / eDX / Udacity for free &#8211; but the certification only holds value when you complete these courses. Also, there will be minimal assistance you will get &#8211; you have to be self motivated to learn from these platforms. Alternately, you can look at Jigsaw and a few others for their certification programmes.</p>
<p>With regards to internship, you can look at the opportunities in Delhi NCR itself &#8211; Absolutdata, Aviva, WNS are some of the companies I know of. Hope this helps.</p>
<p>Regards,<br />
Kunal</p>

<div class="comment-author vcard">
<img alt='' src='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4c9bfcfe71747d7b20cbc66fc164d535?s=100&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g' srcset='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4c9bfcfe71747d7b20cbc66fc164d535?s=200&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g 2x' class='avatar avatar-100 photo' height='100' width='100' /> <cite class="fn">Pravash</cite> <span class="says">says:</span> </div>

<li class="comment even thread-odd thread-alt depth-1" id="comment-35610">
<div id="div-comment-35610" class="comment-body">
<div class="comment-author vcard">
<img alt='' src='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/5ec8496f23b158bb6269d103f38065b4?s=100&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g' srcset='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/5ec8496f23b158bb6269d103f38065b4?s=200&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g 2x' class='avatar avatar-100 photo' height='100' width='100' /> <cite class="fn">Rahul</cite> <span class="says">says:</span> </div>
<div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2013/07/advanced-analytics-certifications/#comment-35610">
October 28, 2014 at 11:58 am</a> </div>
<p>Any idea on how good this program is<br />
Praxis – Now @ Bangalore </p>
<p>Praxis Business School, Kolkata is rolling out its popular analytics program in Bangalore under the aegis of Praxis Academy. </p>
<p>Praxis pioneered the teaching of analytics as a discipline by launching a one-year full-time program in Business Analytics from its campus in Kolkata in 2011, as it believed that India needs to be well-positioned to grasp the huge opportunity this discipline provides to trained professionals. </p>
<p>While the one-year program has grown in strength and stature, and has been ranked in the top-5 analytics programs in the country by the Analytics India Magazine, Praxis has launched weekend classroom training programs in Bangalore and Kolkata for working, time-poor executives. Praxis is confident about the importance of and demand for Data Analytics professionals, and has put together a robust program for working executives that will equip them for a seamless transition into the Analytics world.</p>
<p>Analytics Certification Programs</p>
<p>Basic Certification in Business Analytics	Advanced Certification in Business Analytics<br />
Introduction to Analytics<br />
Advanced Excel &amp; VBA<br />
SQL, Access &amp; Databases<br />
Basic Statistics<br />
Advanced Statistics &amp; Modelling<br />
SAS<br />
Data Visualization – Tableau/ Qlikview<br />
Practice &amp; QA<br />
CV and Job assistance<br />
Program Fee	INR 45,000	INR 55,000<br />
Duration	7 weeks	9 weeks</p>

<p>Nilesh,</p>
<p>Transition from BI to BA would be beneficial. ISB is one of the best course available in India as of now. If you want to move into Business analytics, this would be the best chance. You are an eligible candidate for CBA course. While it does not provide a placement support, but you will expect to learn about the domain.</p>
<p>For more Analytics Program details you can read this article “<a href="http://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2014/12/top-analytics-programs-india-2014-2015/" title="Top 5 Analytics Programs in India (2014 – 15)" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Top 5 Analytics Programs in India (2014 – 15)</a>”.</p>
<p>Regards,<br />
Kunal</p>

<p>Hi Neha,</p>
<p>Analytics companies typically hire freshers only from the top institutes in India (e.g. IIT / NIT / IIM )<br />
You need to put extra effort to pursue career in Analytics. You can check out some other options to pursue in Research &#038; Data Analytics.</p>
<p>I do not have a lot of information about the course from ISI, as it a relatively new course. For short term courses, you can also look at some other options on our training page.</p>
<p>Regards,<br />
Kunal</p>

<div class="comment-author vcard">
<img alt='' src='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/7ee3d5ecda4968c01f432f936b1c98cc?s=100&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g' srcset='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/7ee3d5ecda4968c01f432f936b1c98cc?s=200&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g 2x' class='avatar avatar-100 photo' height='100' width='100' /> <cite class="fn">Hanisha</cite> <span class="says">says:</span> </div>
<div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2013/07/advanced-analytics-certifications/#comment-45734">
November 27, 2014 at 4:38 pm</a> </div>
<p>Hi Kunal,</p>
<p>I am glad that I was able to find this website. Thank you so much for your effort in explaining us about Analytics. I wanted to do CBA from ISB. I am a 2012 CSE Graduate.<br />
After that, I did SAP-BI course through which I was not placed in any company as I was a fresher. Later, May 2014 I was placed in an IT company. </p>
<p>My questions are</p>
<p>1) What would be the chance of me doing this course and getting placed without experience?<br />
2) Would ISB consider fresher in their certification ?<br />
3) When would be the best time for a person like me to start this course i.e considering the work experience?</p>
<p>Thanks,Awaiting for your reply.</p>
<div class="reply"><a rel='nofollow' class='comment-reply-link' href='#comment-45734' onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "div-comment-45734", "45734", "respond", "293" )' aria-label='Reply to Hanisha'>Reply</a></div>

<li class="comment byuser comment-author-kunalj bypostauthor even depth-2" id="comment-81920">
<div id="div-comment-81920" class="comment-body">
<div class="comment-author vcard">
<img alt='' src='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=100&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g' srcset='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=200&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g 2x' class='avatar avatar-100 photo' height='100' width='100' /> <cite class="fn"><a href='http://www.analyticsvidhya.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Kunal Jain</a></cite> <span class="says">says:</span> </div>
<div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2013/07/advanced-analytics-certifications/#comment-81920">
March 20, 2015 at 6:04 pm</a> </div>
<p>Hanisha,</p>
<p>1. The admission to ISB programme is dependent on many parameters rather than just the number of years of experience. On itself, 10 months looks to be on the lower side. The required work experience by ISB is 4-6 years. Presently the chance of getting selected at ISB is very less.<br />
2. ISB doesn&#8217;t prefer fresher for Certified Program in Business Analytics.<br />
3. For pursuing CBA courses, working Professional should possess 4-6 years of full-time work experience.</p>
<p>Regards,<br />
Kunal</p>

<div class="comment-meta commentmetadata"><a href="https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2013/07/advanced-analytics-certifications/#comment-81900">
March 20, 2015 at 4:45 pm</a> </div>
<p>Hi Vikesh,</p>
<p>We feel that the courses from Edupristine cover a very broad range of topics in a short span. You probably won’t get time to digest and apply what you are learning before the course is over!<br />
You can look at other options like General Assembly and Galvanize. Hope this helps.</p>
<p>Regards,<br />
Kunal</p>

<p>Hi Krishna,</p>
<p>Congratulations for the selection.</p>
<p>This course does not provide a placement support, but you would expect that you will have good job prospects. ISB is one of the best course available in India as of now. If you want to move into Business analytics, this is the best chance. With the ISB brand and tie-up with SAS, the course provides almost everything a person want to learn in this domain.</p>
<p>Regards,<br />
Kunal</p>

<p>Hi Kunal</p>
<p>I am BE ( Electronics ) and PGDBM &#8211; Full Time from one of the top 20 Indian Institutes. I have 8 years of total work experience with the break up as follows 4 Years in Sales &amp; Marketing ( 2 years in Insurance, 1 year in Manufacturing and 1 Year in Media ). I also have 4 Years of experience as a Functional Consultant in a leading MNC. I have enrolled for SAS and Big Data courses at Jigsaw Academy. However, I am not being able to find time and energy to immerse myself into the courses ( business analytics in completely different from SAP ) I am seriously considering quitting my job and joining the full time program at Praxis Business School ( Post Graduate Diploma in Business Analytics ). I am planning this because 1 year shall give me more time to evaluate job options as well as to grasp the subject mater in a better manner. Praxis Business School also have an organised placement cell which provides placements in a structured manner. I want to avoid a gap on my CV at all costs as I already have that due to recession. Please advise</p>
<p>Many Thanks</p>

<p>Hi Sumit,</p>
<p>Praxis has a good curriculum and learning experience. You can benefit from it definitely. However, most of the placement efforts are made for entry level positions, which may not be the right fit with your experience. People at Praxis are very helpful and have shown a lot of ownership, but you may need to negotiate for a larger role with potential employers later on.</p>
<p>Regards,<br />
Kunal</p>

<img alt='' src='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=100&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g' srcset='https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/4881b6eff4a916300c9a785c9f103f24?s=200&#038;d=mm&#038;r=g 2x' class='avatar avatar-100 photo' height='100' width='100' /> <cite class="fn"><a href='http://www.analyticsvidhya.com' rel='external nofollow' class='url'>Kunal Jain</a></cite> <span class="says">says:</span> </div>

March 15, 2015 at 5:07 pm</a> </div>
<p>Hi Ac,</p>
<p>You will be considered as a fresher in analytics domain. If you want to make a career shift after such a long experience. You will need to start as a fresher and might find it hard getting a job in industry. You can read this article for more details: “<a href="http://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2014/05/planning-late-career-shift-analytics-big-data-prepared/" title="Planning a late career shift to Analytics / Big data? Better be prepared!" rel="nofollow">Planning a late career shift to Analytics/ Big data? Better be prepared</a>”.</p>
<p>Other option could be to take up an HR position for short term and pursue an analytics certification in parallel.</p>
<p>Regards,<br />
Kunal</p>

3. Lastly, if there are ny questions from my side.</p>

Rahul</p>
